description: General information All posting locations Amsterdam, , Netherlands Job Function 11 - Logistics Date Published 20-Sep-2023 Ref # R-74042 Remote, Hybrid or Onsite HybridRequirements Description & Requirements The Global Head of Supply Planning ( MPS- DS & DRP ) assumes the significant accountability of designing and implementing global strategies pertaining to master plan schedules- daily scheduling- and distribution resource planning. The primary focus of this role revolves around upholding standardized processes and systems that reflect common and standard methodologies- and support the implementation with the business units.Given its extensive cross-functional involvement across functions such as Manufacturing- Procurement- NPD (New Product Development)- Logistics- and more- this role necessitates a comprehensive understanding of our industry and proficiency in problem-solving.This role is expected to solve complex challenges- develop and execute objectives for oneself and others- and possess the ability to formulate both short-term and long-term business goals. Additionally- active participation in Kraft Heinz-wide Operations projects is required. It demands critical thinking- effective problem-solving capabilities- and the ability to influence diverse cross-functional teams and their leaders.Moreover- this function brings critical business expertise to the overall management of supply planning. It assumes responsibility for leading the design of processes- configuring systems- and deploying these systems to facilitate efficient supply planning operations.Reports into Global Head of E2E Business Planning Role What's on the Menu? The Global Head Supply Planning is responsible for designing and implementing global strategies for master plan schedules- daily scheduling- and distribution resource planning. The role upholds standardized processes and systems that reflect common and best practices and support the implementation with the business units. It also solves complex challenges- develop and execute objectives- and formulate short-term and long-term business goals. The role will participate in Kraft Heinz-wide Operations projects and bring critical business expertise to the overall management of supply planning. It will lead the design of processes- configure systems- and deploy them to facilitate efficient supply planning operations.The Essentials Lead and coordinate the design of supply planning processes and systems. 2. Set global vision and strategies for supply planning- aligning with organizational goals. Execute supply planning roadmap in alignment with strategic plans. Participate in cross-functional projects to improve business processes. Identify and implement improvements to supply planning processes and KPIs. Develop a comprehensive digital roadmap for supply planning transformation. Design- implement- and govern process improvements with best practices. Coordinate actions to improve daily scheduling and resource utilization- enhancing the factory modulation. Lead annual target setting process and track performance. Lead projects- engaging multiple business units and markets. Cultivate relationships with vendors and system integrators. Maintain understanding of supply planning processes and standards. Drive user adoption and provide training on supply planning systems. Champion talent development within the supply planning community. Recipe for Success Apply now if this sounds like you! Extensive experience in supply planning- preferably in a global or large-scale organization. Working experience in planning systems (OMP or Kinaxis). Strong knowledge of supply planning processes- best practices- and industry trends. Demonstrated experience in designing and implementing supply planning processes and systems. Proficiency in supply planning software and tools. Consistent record of driving process improvements and achieving KPI targets in supply planning. Experience in cross-functional project management- collaborating with teams from Manufacturing- Procurement- NPD- Logistics- and other relevant functions. Familiarity with digital technologies and their application in supply planning- including process automation- data analytics- and forecasting tools.The Ingredients Strong problem-solving skills to address complex challenges and find effective solutions. Ability to collaborate and influence diverse cross-functional teams. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills- including engagement with senior leadership. Strong project management skills to lead multifunctional project teams. Experience in a complex multi-country- multilingual- and time zone environment. Focus on continuous improvement and driving operational excellence in supply planning. Positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Functional experience in FMCG industries is helpful. We hope to find you a seat at our table! About UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Data scientist
description: FunctiebeschrijvingAls Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten & onderhouden van het Datawarehouse van een mobiele app. Hierin heb je zowel een strategische als uitvoerende rol en ben je degene die overkoepelend kijkt naar mogelijkheden om data steeds slimmer in te zetten ten behoeve van relevantie voor de users van de app. Deze rol geeft jou als ervaren Data Engineer de mogelijkheid in samenwerking met de verschillende development teams tot gezamenlijke inzichten te komen en het datawarehouse verder op te zetten en aan te sluiten op de dagelijkse activiteiten van de app. Het datawarehouse is een belangrijke spil waarin data van veel verschillende bronnen samenkomen om de verschillende use cases binnen de app te ondersteunen. De engineer is bij uitstek iemand die vanuit de verschillende doelen/use cases de vertaling kan maken naar de technische invulling en hierbij zowel bronnen in front- als back end aan elkaar weet aan te sluiten. Wat ga je doen?Je onderhoudt en sluit verschillende (interne) bronnen (zowel front- als back end bronnen) aan;je creëert een toekomstvaste visie met betrekking tot inzetten van data; je koppelt de warehouse aan verschillende web en app omgevingen.Wie ben jij? Ervaring met het onderhouden van een data warehouse & data pipeline architectuur (binnen AWS) Ervaring met gangbare tooling in data: Airflow, dbt, Metabase, PowerBI, Redis, e.a. Ervaring met het opzetten van complexe ETL pipelines en orchestration van deze ETL processen (binnen AWS) Ervaring met AWS (specifiek: Redshift, Aurora Serverless, DynamoDB, & RErvaring met CI/CD processen (Pre) gecertificeerd: AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty Wat bieden wij jou? De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen (professioneel en persoonlijk) via ons Live your potential programma. Dit is een aanrader voor zowel starters als ervaren professionals;een competitief salaris;100% reiskostenvergoeding met het openbaar vervoer, € 0,21 cent per kilometer met de auto;een internationale omgeving en diversiteit;pensioenopbouw direct bij aanvang van je opdracht;25 vakantiedagen per jaar.Een brutomaandsalaris tussen €4.250,- en €4.950,- op basis van een 40-urige werkweekInteresse in deze vacature? Solliciteer via deze pagina, of neem direct contact op met recruiter Sara Carlos Campos via s.carloscampos@wearekayak.com of 0629677665.

title: Data Scientist
description: About PacmedAt Pacmed we develop world leading AI-based decision support software for intensive care doctors. It’s a hugely exciting area where we’re breaking boundaries every day. We’re looking for a data scientist who’s excited to work with hospitals on implementing our product. We have currently implemented our software in our first ICUs and have the ambitions to scale across the Netherlands and beyond.What This Role Is All AboutAs Data Scientist in the Implementation & Care team, you work closely with the hospitals to implement our software. The team as a whole is on a mission to reduce the time it takes to implement our product significantly by the end of 2024, and as you are working with our clients directly, your work is an integral part of reaching that goal.Next to Brian (Implementation Manager) and Ewoud (Adoption Specialist), we have another Data Scientist on the team: Mattia, who broadened his skillset to include the engineering capabilities needed for implementations. In this role, we hope you are excited about going through a similar learning curve!One thing you can be sure of, every day you’ll be working with enthusiastic and mission-driven people who are passionate about using technology to revolutionize healthcare!What Would Be Expected Of YouWork with our customers to ensure the timely, within budget and at quality standards integration of Pacmed Critical in the hospital ICT infrastructure. You need to be excited about working with customers directly!Proactively supporting hospital partners throughout the implementation process, and contributing to meeting the overall project planning.Learning how to set up, test, and ensure quality of integrations, including:Setting up the Azure environment for hospitals, safe network connections, real-time data connection, and single sign-on.Embedding and integration of Pacmed Critical in the front-end of the hospitals EPD/PDMS.Critically assess areas of improvement/automatization of the current development process, suggest ways to improve it and coordinate with the other relevant teams in Pacmed for their implementation.Contributing to the training of the machine-learning (ML) models behind Pacmed Critical, their testing and deployment to the hospital IT environment.Responsible for the technical aspects of the customer support provided to hospitals in which Pacmed Critical has already been implemented.The perks of working at PacmedWhy Pacmed is a great place to workWe're a dynamic startup committed to improving healthcare globally.We’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for our team.We’re a talented bunch of people dedicated to helping each other grow.We foster a culture of kindness and respect.We're a team of ambitious and fun-loving people, with regular team eventsThe profile we’re looking forMust-havesThere is no need to apply if you don’t meet these requirements, sorry!Fluency in DutchCommunication, presentation and consultancy skills. This is a client-facing role, so you need to be excited about that!Desire to become proficient in the production deployment of ML models. The candidate is expected to quickly gain expertise in the technologies currently in use at Pacmed, e.g. data warehousing, ML DevOps, containerisation, automatized integration and deployments (CI/CD) and Cloud infrastructures.Experience in data science, data wrangling, machine learning and data visualization. Ability to set up a supervised learning ML model and interpret its results.Should-havesWe hope you bring these things as well, but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes.Previous experience in a client-facing role.Proficiency with Python and common data-science packages (e.g. scikit-learn, pandas, etc.).Experience with IT integrations, networking and deployments.Experience in process optimization.Collaborative & team player.Nice-to-havesThese are things that would make your profile jump out!Previous experience in data engineering (see third bullet point in the “Must-have” section).Previous experience with version control software.Previous experience in software development.Medical knowledge or previous work experience in the medical field.At Pacmed, we think there is strength in diversity. Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Pacmed encourages you to reconsider and apply! Building responsible AI requires diverse perspectives, equitable practices, and integrity every step of the way. This is our commitment.We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Quantitative Trader, Amsterdam
description: Are you a recent graduate with high ambition, ready to take initiative as a part of an environmental finance scale-up? Are you ready to develop cutting-edge trading strategies using your excellent quantitative skills? Would you like to get the chance to implement and automatize financial solutions into the tradable environmental markets? Then this role might be perfect for you!About UsOTC Flow is a leading trading company specialized in trading across European and local renewable power markets. We provide liquidity in virtually all financial-environmental instruments in Europe, China and the US. We are currently expanding our business with on-exchange trading on the European carbon, power & gas market and we are looking for the highly-skilled and motivated quantitative trader to join our ambitious and dynamic team.About The RoleWe are seeking the most talented candidates with a strong quantitative educational background to join our trading team. As a Quantitative Trader, you will be responsible for developing and implementing sophisticated trading strategies in the carbon, power, and gas markets to optimize risk-adjusted returns.Main ResponsibilitiesQuantitative Analysis: Conduct in-depth quantitative analysis of the carbon, power, and gas markets using advanced mathematical and econometric models. Identify trading opportunities, market trends, and price patterns to develop profitable strategies;Risk Management: Evaluate and manage trading risks to ensure the overall stability and profitability of the trading portfolio. Employ risk management techniques to mitigate market exposure and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.Market Research: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the carbon, power, and gas markets, as well as relevant economic and geopolitical factors that influence market dynamics;Optimization & automation: build and maintain trading models using programming languages like Python;Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including traders, data scientists, and analysts, to contribute to the overall trading strategy and decision-making process.Functie-eisenAbout youYou hold a quantitative Master’s degree in Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Physics, or other related with outstanding grades;Relevant experience in on-exchange trading of power, gas, or carbon is a must (at least an internship);Experience gained in financial markets (either study or work);Advanced knowledge of Python and SQL;Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills;Ability to work in an accurate and structured way;Fluent in English;You like to set up things from scratch.Functie-voorstelWhat we offerA fast-growing, international working environment where every day can be an opportunity to learn;A competitive remuneration package with discretionary bonus options;Direct exposure to Management, with a chance to help drive the strategic roadmap of a fast-growing company in the environmental space;After the first 6 months, we intend to offer you an indefinite position, including an attractive remuneration package including bonus scheme;Free lunch & snacks;Travel expenses covered (OV/Swap-bicycle plan etc.);25 vacation days;Social events & activities with a fun team, including company trips (London/Ibiza).What's nextIf we have just described your profile, do not miss out on this opportunity.The Recruitment Process Is As FollowsSubmit your application with your CV and university grade list;We will get to know you better through a pre-screening interview;We will invite you for an interview with the hiring manager.Please note that sometimes there are slight changes to this process.We believe that an inclusive work environment will encourage growth as a company, as a team and as individuals. We will therefore consider all applicants because we want to promote an inclusive work culture that is accessible to all.5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

title: Process Engineer, Energy - Tilburg
description: What To ExpectThe process engineer will implement, develop, and optimize production methodologies in the manufacturing operations of Tesla. This engineer will be responsible for optimizing product flow through the factory by implementing process optimization that may include tool/fixture selection, line layouts, ergonomic study, material presentation, and other relevant factors. He/She will interface with design, test, and quality engineering to solve problems, improve manufacturability, and implement continual improvement. He/She will sustain products with cost reduction and yield improvements. In addition, the process engineer will work with quality to compile and evaluate data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specificationsWhat You'll DoDevelop and improve line layouts, including material flow, waste reduction, and ergonomics, utilizing Lean Manufacturing best practices. Drive changes through Production Change Approval process.Champion continuous improvement projects (CIP) to maximize yield, capacity, and capability.Create and maintain Manufacturing Instructions, Process Flows, PFMEA’s, Control Plans, and associated processes. Develop and train sustaining technicians, assist in the training of operators as needed. Manage activities for process sustaining technicians to support day to day coverage of production line, including developing and documenting appropriate rework procedures.Enable data driven operational and financial decisions through predictive insights into tool and process performance, including integration of factory data systems and use of software such as MySQL, Python, R, JMP, Minitab, Tableau and Ignition.Utilize structured problem solving techniques such as DMAIC, Ishikawa, Five Why (5W) and Eight Disciplines (8D).Responsible for diagnosing issues found during the part (re)manufacturing process and drive corrective action back to source, resulting in root cause identification and elimination.Leading a small team of Engineering Technicians.What You'll BringBS degree in engineering or equivalent in experience.Experience developing and improving Process. Good understanding of Bill of Materials, Manufacturing Execution System, Specification Management, Change Management.Data collection and analysis experience. Ability to develop data driven root cause analyses and solutions.Strong problem solving skills and an aptitude for learning systems quickly. Able to utilize structured problem solving techniques such as DMAIC, Ishikawa, Five Why (5W), Eight Disciplines (8D) or Statistical Process Control. Able to resolve high level performance issues into addressable actions.Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities, competing priorities and challenges. Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with global teams and peers within a manufacturing and engineering organization. This includes excellent communication skills: written and verbal.Creative capacity for developing new ways to do things better, cheaper, faster in alignment with the Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: Data Analyst
description: Sam Media is a team of passionate and fearless creatives, marketing experts, Data wizards, and developers focused on delivering great products and services to hundreds of millions of mobile consumers worldwide. We are one of the pioneers and a leader in the mobile micropayment sector.We are an online performance marketing company, we build and market our products including Mobile Apps, Streaming Video and Music Services, Online Learning Portals and Mobile Games. Millions of users engage with our promotional content and digital ads every single day.We are a diverse team of more than 34 nationalities based in Kuala Lumpur, Amsterdam, Dubai, and Hanoi. We value ambition, open communication and learning from each other.As a data analyst, you will have a central role contributing to many decisions that we make every day. You develop actionable, data-driven insight for optimization of our creative campaigns, discovering hidden opportunities, or digging into the root cause of a discrepancy. You make sound arguments, supported by data for taking or discarding an opportunity.We are looking for a motivational candidate who can support our multidisciplinary teams finding actionable insights from our data and also work on developing new tools that help our company improve business performance from our Amsterdam office.About YouYou have hands-on software development and analytical skills. Our ideal colleague should love getting their hands dirty with building solutions, doing research, analyzing data and programming. You will need knowledge in designing and shipping solutions and tools across the whole stack.What will you be doing?Supporting our cross-functional teams. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, generating reports, preparing data visualizations, and using data to forecast or guide business activity. Our main tools for this are Redshift (SQL) and Quicksight.Find actionable insights on our data and communicate them to improve and optimize our business.Design, build/improve and maintain internal projects built in Python, such as our early alerting system or our IP targeting optimization project. Both projects are currently being used within the company for error monitoring and process optimization respectively. And if you feel brave enough you can help to deploy them with Docker and Airflow!What do we expect from you?You should have a passion for coding, optimizing for business value and enjoy solving problems and building correct, extensible and simple solutions that match our scale and load.You should be proficient with Python and SQL. Having 3+ years of relevant experience as an analyst and/or software developer.Several of our projects are being built using Django, would be a plus if you have previously worked using this framework as we are continuous developing these projects.We use AWS suite (Redshift as our main analytical database along a swarm of EC2 to keep our services alive), Docker, Git, Airflow so a basic understanding of these technologies would be a nice to have.You are able to work in a fast-paced and multicultural environment where the main working language is English so fluency in verbal and written English is a must.What do we offer?A Competitive salary in line with market conditions and your skills and experienceAlthough this position isn't remote, we offer flexible working schedules.Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture. We trust our team members to get the job done, how they do it is up to them.We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company tripWe have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.We offer visa sponsorship and a comprehensive relocation package when applicable.

title: Data Analyst
description: 🔋🔋 Data Analyst 🔋🔋1-2 day in the office a week (its up to you!)€95k per annumUtrechtSustainabilityStarting salary up to €7,800/month, electric car lease, €150 per month professional cost cover , €850 phone budget (renewed every 3 years), €3,000 laptop budget (renewed every 3 years), pension, min 5% bonus, huge growth potential, a pioneering opportunity within the sustainability sector, work on innovating greenfield projects amongst other standard benefits.Who are they…This is a company for extraordinary talent. A company that does amazing things that makes the Digital future for their clients happen. With a unique approach and attitude! Using data, AI and IoT.They build data heavy intelligent solutions which captures real time data to...Reduce the energy impact of entire cities!!Help in the fight against cancerThey design and build innovative solutions that have the power to transform businesses so that they stay competitive and can continue to grow. Digital Strategy execution that makes companies more agile and flexible. Advanced Analytics that gives them insight into what happens now or in the nearby future by recognising specific patterns in their data."It’s easy to build something complex. It’s pretty hard to create the same thing elegantly simple. That is why you need the smartest people you can get."We are actively seeking a number of Medior & Senior Data Analysts who have a passion to develop innovative, sustainable platforms.Key Requirements…Ability to develop and implement Azure Synapse, Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL Server and PowerBIExtensive experience in SQL and no-SQL query languageExperience building ETL pipelinesThe "You're too perfect" Wish List…Understanding of core data integration technologies such as Power Automate and Logic Apps.Experience with AI and/or IoT How to Apply…Directly apply to this post with your CV or…Call Will Aldred on +31 202414822 (Direct Line)

title: Data Analyst at Chapter Data
description: Data Analyst at Chapter DataRequirements2–4 years of experienceA Master’s degree, preferably in a business or quantitative direction such as Econometrics, Statistics, Finance, Marketing, or Business AdministrationExperience with Google analytics, SQL or other programming language is a plusWe won’t actually want you to work with Microsoft Excel but there is a high probability that finance will ask for it somedayWell-versed in Storytelling and Stakeholder ManagementVacancy: Data AnalystAs a Data Analyst at Chapter Data, you’ll Fast-Track your career while working with our diverse clients, of different sizes, and at various levels of data maturity. You’ll help them navigate the future by taking lessons from the past, getting the most useful and applicable insights out of the available data. You will answer questions such as ‘What happened?’ and ‘Why did it happen? Chapter Data: Supercharge your professional GrowthAs a Data Analytics professional, what you want more than anything is to learn and to grow. At Chapter Data we strongly believe that one-on-one coaching, tailored to your personality and growth goals, works better than any cookie-cutter trainee program — in getting you to that next step as fast as possible.Our clients and their challengesOur clients and their work can range from the Dutch market leader in online shopping Bol.com, exciting fintech companies building innovative solutions in the financial industry, to one of the world’s most famous, socially and environmentally responsible FMGC brands at Ben & Jerry’s. What they all have in common, is that they need help with identifying and tapping into the true value ofthe data available in their company. And to do so in the most innovative, ethical, and sustainable way.We help them create a company-wide Data Strategy, build their engineering and Data Analytics capacity, and to implement a truly Data-driven culture and ditto leadership. And that’s where you come in.The challenge and environment for youAs a Data Analyst at Chapter Data, you will work with clients of different sizes, and at various stages of data maturity. Your work will help clients develop insights and recommendations that solve complex business problems.Your main challenge will be to collaborate with various stakeholders to understand their business problems, and to translate their questions into data-driven insights. You will use storytelling techniques to explain the story behind the numbers, to elaborate what happened and why it’s happened, to communicate it to stakeholders at all levels of the client organization.Practically, you will focus on data reporting, creating meaningful and easy-to-understand and easy-to-use dashboards around subjects like key performance indicators (KPIs), sales growth, profitability, cashflow, or days of inventory on hand (DOH). You’ll apply data analysis and basic statistics to identify trends, patterns, and potential anomalies. You’ll develop your capability for the application of statistics such as in A/B testing, and you’ll continuously explore the broader possibilities that Business Intelligence has to offer – advising on how organizations can leverage them, fitting to their strategic needs.You’ll do all of this with one-on-one coaching and on-the-job learning, from a very experienced senior Data Expert; our co-founder Sander Klinkenberg.Fast-Track your Data Analysis CareerTaking up the role of Data Analyst at Chapter Data really means pushing your career forward. Especially if you have or are currently developing both the technical knowledge and the business acumen that a truly exceptional Data Analyst needs. If you’re a junior or medior Data Analyst who really wants to take the next step and who also wants to put in the effort to get it — this can be a great opportunity to put your career trajectory on the Fast Track. Apply nowSounds like the next step for you? Contact Daan Bouman at daan.bouman@topofminds.com to express your interest – and let’s set up an introductory call to get acquainted.

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, togetherWe live in an era where electric mobility is “the new normal.” Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox.Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone.We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That’s why we’ve made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation.The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us.About UsAt the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions.Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build.About The RoleAs a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future.In This Role You WillAnalyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiencyDesign, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processesCollaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progressProvide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making processDevelop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiativesBeing able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domainsEnhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliabilityAbout YouYou hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functionsAdvanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plusExperienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similarAbility to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detailProven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeawaysProven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using dataBenefitsAt EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard:A very diverse workforce and an open culturePrivate pension contribution25 vacation daysHoliday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation dayCommuting allowanceUp to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager)Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home officeAbility to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeksAccess to learning platforms and personal development budgetAcross our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply.We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all.We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard.Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Data Analyst
description: Binnen Catom is één van onze kernwaarden Innovatie, wat zich ook vertaalt in de manier hoe we met data & informatie om gaan en willen gaan.De data-driven organisatie is voor ons ‘key’ in het behalen van onze ambities en het realiseren van onze visie. Daarom blijven we investeren in Business Intelligence waarbij we nu op het punt zijn gekomen om deze rol binnen onze organisatie verder concreet vorm te geven en zijn wij nu op zoek naar een Data & Business Analyst!Primair ga je aan de slag met een aantal speerpunten om onze eerste slag te slaan bij het verder ontwikkelen van onze data-driven organisatie, denk hierbij aan:Ontwikkelen, uitrollen en opvolgen van de wekelijkse business update;Ontwikkelen van de nieuwe Management Informatie dashboards en rapporten met behulp van Salesforce & PowerBI;Support bieden aan de CFO rondom budgettering cycles, rapportages en forecasting;In deze rol:Je fungeert als Business Analyst en Power BI expert, waarbij je de wensen van stakeholders vanuit de hele organisatie vertaalt naar data en heldere dashboards;Je ontwikkelt deze Power BI dashboards zelfstandig waarbij je gebruik maakt van de nieuwste technieken en mogelijkheden;Je toetst regelmatig met jouw stakeholders of de dashboards voldoende helder zijn en de informatie geven die zij nodig hebben;Samen met ons team haal je gegevens uit ons Data Lake en verrijk je deze indien nodig.Naast standaard rapportage-packs lever je ook data en modellen aan voor strategische besluitvorming;Je werkt samen met diverse collega’s vanuit al onze businesses; Retail, Marine, Oliecentrale en Wholesale.Welke kennis en ervaring neem je mee?Je hebt een passie voor Data en Analytics;Daarnaast heb je een afgeronde Master richting Finance, Bedrijfseconomie, Bedrijfskunde of Informatietechnologie of vergelijkbaar;Je hebt 1 tot max. 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie;Je hebt veel ervaring met het maken van dashboards;Je hebt ruime ervaring met MS Excel, PowerBI en eventuele andere BI tools;Je bent in staat abstracte data om te zetten naar bruikbare informatie en dit te helder en duidelijk te presenteren;Wie ben jij?Je bent resultaatgericht, kunt goed prioriteren en komt je afspraken na.Je hebt een positieve en pragmatische instelling en een probleemoplossend vermogen.Je hebt goede analytische vaardigheden en communicatieve vaardigheden.Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je bent in staat jouw analyses en uitkomsten helder over te brengen naar anderen;Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal volledig, in woord en schrift;Je hebt onbegrensde interesse in nieuwe technologieën ten aanzien van data analytics en vindt het leuk hiermee aan de slag te gaan in jouw rol als business analyst.Ons aanbodMarktconform salaris;Gunstige pensioenregeling met een beperkte eigen bijdrage (2%);26 vakantiedagen;OK Personeelspas met kortingen op het tankstation en een bijdrage voor de sportschool/fitness.

title: Data Analyst
description: Start date: 02-01-2024Project duration: 12 monthsHours: 32-40 per weekLocation: Arnhem / Remote (minimum 2 days office)Rate: € 70-80phResponsibilities:Information analyses and drawing up specifications.Developing ETL applications, Data Marts, Reports and Dashboards based on the specifications. Developing analytics facilities.Preparation of documentation.Skills:Experience with at least 4 BI projectsSQL Power BI4-5 years experience with data analytics/BI

title: Data Analyst
description: Wat ga je doen?Jij bent een kei met cijfers en wordt hierdoor uitgedaagd. Computerprogramma’s weet je je snel eigen te maken en te doorgronden (ERP systemen, Power BI en calculatieprogramma).Samen met de Categorie Leaders zorg je dat ons assortiment up- to-date blijft waarbij jij je met name focust op de inrichting en door ontwikkelen van de systemen en rapportages zowel nationaal al internationaal.Door jouw analyses kun je onderbouwen dat ons assortiment aan de vraag van de huidige consument kan voldoen. In deze analytische rol ben je actief betrokken bij het financieel onderbouwen van nieuwe producten voor onze verschillende concepten.Je bent continue op zoek naar mogelijkheden om de kosten te optimaliseren. Analyseert inkoopcontracten zodat we maximale inkoopbonussen kunnen realiseren. Als analist werk je nauw samen met de afdelingen Sales, Finance, Supply Chain en R&D. Een veelzijdige functie met als werkgebied de BENELUX.Over jou Je bent analytisch, klant-, markt-, en resultaatgericht.Je bent stressbestendig, flexibel en staat stevig in je schoenen.Je werkt zeer gestructureerd en accuraat.Je ziet en benut kansen en bent initiatiefrijk.Je beschikt over HBO werk- en denkniveau en kan uiteraard met Excel (gevorderd) overweg.Je communiceert goed in het Nederlands en in het Engels.Selecta biedt Je maakt deel uit van een organisatie waar met plezier wordt gewerkt aan mooie koffieconcepten. Wij voorzien in een open en enthousiaste werkomgeving met volop ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.• Een interessante functie met ruimte voor ondernemerschap en vrijheid;• Hybride werken;• Individueel keuze budget, ten hoogte van 1 maand salaris;• 8% vakantiegeld, 25 vakantiedagen;• Collectieve zorgverzekering;• De beste koffie (en meer) die er is!• Een pensioenverzekering bij BeFrank van 5% eigen bijdrage. Wij betalen de rest!Interesse en solliciteren? Heb je interesse én voldoe je aan het profiel? Dan kom ik graag in contact met je. Voor vragen over deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Romilda Vakkers, Regional recruiter via nl.recruitment@selecta.com of +31 627252862

title: Business Data Analyst
description: **BUSINESS DATA ANALYST****DUTCH SPEAKING****UP TO €72,000****AMSTERDAM****HYBRID**THE COMPANYThe company is a cutting-edge Software as a Service (SaaS) company based in the Netherlands, at the forefront of digital transformation and innovation. Established with a vision to empower businesses and organizations with smart, cloud-based solutions, they have quickly become a trusted partner for companies seeking to streamline their operations, enhance productivity, and drive growth via offering:- Innovative SaaS solutions- User-centric approach- Data-driven insights- Customisation and scalability- Continuous innovation- Global reach- Exceptional support- Security and ComplianceTHE ROLEAs a Business Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping data-driven strategies and helping make informed decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and leverage your analytical skills to extract meaningful insights from data, enabling us to drive growth and innovation in the business.Responsibilities:Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with teams across the organization to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs).Develop predictive models and conduct statistical analyses to support decision-making.Assist in the design and implementation of data-driven experimentsIdentify areas for process improvement and efficiency gains through data analysis.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.THE REQUIREMENTSBachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or related).DUTCH SPEAKINGMinimum 1-year experience in a commercial or SaaS backgroundProven experience in data analysis and data visualization using tools such as Python, R, SQL, or Tableau.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Knowledge of business processes and a strong business acumen.Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.WANT TO APPLY?Please apply below to find out more! Or send your CV directly to:Please note, only SUCCESSFUL applicants will be contacted.

title: Data Analyst
description: We're Creative Fabrica, a fast scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.Our missionEnable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating and sharing. The 'Creative Inspiration Flywheel'This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.About The PlatformWe launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 7 years we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, viewing over 10 million+ listed products from 14000+ active designers.Our focus is to create a platform for designers that enables them to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.We are growing. Fast. You will help us grow even faster.Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. If you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.What you will do:Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency. Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making. Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations. Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies. Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions. Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes. What you will bring:Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field. Strong programming skills in SQLExperience with data visualization and data analysis toolsKnowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Nice to have:Experience in complex modelling e.g. Fraud detection or time-series predictionStrong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R and/or other relevant tools. Experience and/or understanding in dbt (Data Build Tool)Let us take care of you.We embrace state-of-the-art technologies. We firmly believe in the potential of AI as the future of work. You will see us using ChatGPT in our daily work and your Pro subscription is on us. Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills and ambition should be fairly compensated. Flexibility: 30 remote days per year. The best tools and stylish kit: Laptop. Check. Collaboration tools. Check. Killer accessories. Check. Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the centre, working here means delicious lunches in the garden, and access to our own CF library. TGIF: Work Life balance is important - we work hard together, and we have fun together. On Fridays we gather at the bar across the street and start celebrating the weekend. Is this you?Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.You can apply by clicking the "Apply now" button.Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Interested in roles similar to this? Subscribe to our newsletter and get notified about new relevant openings!

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Marketing roles, to join our client, a sustainable mobility startup. The role can be developed onsite at their new Amsterdam offices, or on a hybrid solution (1 day / week for meetings and team building).Their team is young and international, which is why we seek someone who is fluent in English, comfortable with tech and likes to stay up to date with the latest trends and tools.We look for someone who is passionate about sustainable mobility, has experience in a role that also mixed marketing and data analysis, and demonstrable knowledge of:MarketingSQLRArcGISQGISMicrosoft PowerBIMicrosoft Excel (power user)FigmaCanvaSlackJiraGoogle AnalyticsAccounting and / or financial knowledge (reports, performance, etc).Solid understanding of sustainable mobility concepts, technologies, innovations, research, will be highly valued.

title: Data-Analyst (Power BI)
description: Are you that analyst that performs best in a rapidly changing and international environment, where no two days are the same? Do you have experience working with Power BI and preparing (financial) reports that help a company perform its best? Northpool B.V. is looking for a Data Analyst (Power BI)!GRASP THE OPPORTUNITYAs a Data Analyst (Power BI) at Northpool, you will be working together with different departments -in particular IT and Finance-, to use as much data as possible and making analyses, (financial) reports and presentations related to the performance of the various departments. With these reports, our goal is to provide insight into the costs and performance of our trading desks to make recommendations about business decisions and -goals.Your goal? To translate the business needs and results into user-friendly reports.There is no need to reinvent the wheel: the BI environment is there and the departments themselves provide input about what information they want to get from the trading databases. It is important that you know how to work with Power BI and that you have basic knowledge of finance; you must be able to communicate well with both IT as well as the business and you need to interpret the data and reports properly. It is not necessary to be fully aware of the world of Energy Trading, but you must be able to understand the background of the formation of the prices. We will help you gain the knowledge you need.During your work at Northpool you will:Be responsible for the reporting environment;Prepare overall monthly reports and analysis on business results;Give the individual departments insight into their results;Provide the Finance department with the mandatory monthly, quarterly and annual reports;Report errors/ inaccuracies;Convert the raw data (like the trade database) into clear reports, including using Power BIMaintain existing dashboards, but also expanding reports and analyzes in the long run;Your challenge is to give each department insight into how they are performing and to show where there is room for improvement, by giving them user-friendly and clear reports.WE ASK:Demonstrable experience with developing reports (Power BI) and a strong foundation in SQLMaster’s degree in a data- or finance-related study (f.e. Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, Information Systems)Strong data analytics skillsKnowledge of the basics of accounting and financeA self-motivated individual who will take ownership of their workSomeone who is eager to learn and not afraid to ask questionsGood social and communication skills≥ 2 years of work experienceGood knowledge of ExcelAttention to detail and commitment to accuracyAbility to communicate fluently in EnglishWE LIKE:Interest in trading and energy markets.Willingness to learn and continuously develop yourselfA problem-solving attitudeExperience with financial markets, especially energy marketsWE OFFER:Appropriate training will be providedContinuous learning and development opportunitiesCompetitive compensation packageAnnual performance-based bonusA non-hierarchical workplaceYoung and highly motivated teammatesOwnership in your workA fun workplace, where no two days are ever the samePlenty of social events!Location: for this vacancy we need you to live in The Netherlands. Also, the application procedure will take place at our office in Leiden.Interested? We'd love to meet you! Please send your resume and a short motivation to careers@northpool.nl. Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data Analyst - AutomotiveStart Date: ASAP - January 2024. We can accommodate a normal 4-week notice periodContract Length: 6 Months + ExtensionLocation: Hybrid, 2-3 day on-site in Utrecht, 2-3 days remote.Hours: 36-40H per weekPay: €60 - € 70 per Hour - NEGOTIABLE, please share your rate it is not within this range.Languages: English I am working with a leading motor manufacturing company that is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team in Utrecht on an initial 6-month contract. This initial contract is expected to be extended. Ideally, we are looking for someone that would be able to start this project as soon as possible, however, we can accommodate a reasonable notice period. As a Data/Business Analyst within Measurement Data Management (MDM), your primary responsibility revolves around ensuring the collection of diverse vehicle usage data from vehicles via remote transmissions in a backend IoT application. This data will then be disseminated to various business applications, serving a wide array of business needs. Your role involves configuring the collection process from the vehicles' CAN bus and a telematics connectivity device (TCU) for transmission to the backend.You'll be an integral part of the 'Measurement Data Management Team' (MDM team) within the Global Connected Services department. Operating within the scrum framework, this team operates in 2-week sprints, focusing on delivering meticulously designed, developed, and tested measurement configurations aligned with specific requirements. The team has well-defined business processes and a documented Way of Working, ensuring proper handling and documentation of designs, data configurations, encountered defects, and incidents for efficient resolution. Qualities and Skills:A thorough analyst who relishes dissecting business and IT challenges, processes, and information.Approachable with excellent communication skills, adept at engaging stakeholders and being easily approachable in return.A touch of tenacity, willing to take initiative to resolve issues proactively.Comfortable working without formal requirements, designs, or handover documentation.Proficient in retroactively defining requirements when not formally communicated.Skilled in gathering information/requirements from diverse internal stakeholders.Adaptable to a dynamic and innovative environment, with stress-resilience.Capable of promptly presenting results to the product owner with minimal handover.Willingness/ability to work 2-3 days a week on site.Proficient in English, the primary working language. Experience and Knowledge:General understanding of ICE and BEV automotive knowledge and basic comprehension of functional vehicle behavior.Proficiency in CAN networks, including dbc-files, can-interfaces, wiring harnesses, hex and binary calculations.Familiarity with SAE J1939 and FMS standards.Fundamental understanding of data streaming.Knowledge of high-frequency data transmission concepts such as RabbitMQ, Confluent, Apache Kafka.Experience working in Agile environments and within scrum teams.Experience in validating incomplete/undocumented software applications.(Preferred) Prior experience in validating/testing embedded software functionality.(Preferred) Experience in data analysis/validation, especially with large datasets. Skills:Snowflake/SQLJSON + REST APIs(Preferred) Python (generic scripting, robot framework, flask, pandas)(Preferred) MicroFocus ALM If this looks like you, please apply with your updated CV! 😊

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: About UsDyson is growing fast, and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Pioneering technology takes more than just inventive engineers. At Dyson, we take a problem-solving approach to everything we do. And across our support teams, we’re proud to be different supporting change to maintain our rapid growth. We push the boundaries of what others have defined as possible. Our approach starts with an engineering mindset and different thinking. Then we continuously refine our ideas – unwilling to compromise and driven by an obsession for finding a better way.The EMEA Business Intelligence & Analytics team supports our commercial operations to develop insightful dashboards that supports data driven decision making. The team reaches across the value chain from supply operations to customer retention delivering actionable reporting, supporting measurement of initiatives and operationalising our data. Our responsibility is delivering scalable insights and tools through close market partnership.About The RoleAs a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of the Analytics team by automating and transforming solutions for our partners in the EMEA Region. We are a project-based team where you will own 2-3 projects concurrently capturing requirements, defining and delivering insights. You will leverage structured and unstructured data sets to produce recommendations that enhance our financial performance.Every day will be different, and you will have the opportunity to engage with stakeholders across the business. This role requires a consultative approach to provide support & guidance in delivering Business Intelligence needs in a variety of ways, be it data acquisition, visualization or analysis depending on the project.About You3-5 years of Tableau Development experience (or equivalent tool)Self-motivated with the ability to work independentlyAbility to understand, analyse, report on and present/visualise data in an engaging wayCommercially astute and financially savvy in contextualising business valueInquisitive mind-set and can collaborate with individuals and teams both cross-functionality and geographicallyConfident and credible when working with a wide range of people across the business.Benefits Discount on Dyson products Company Pension scheme 29 days annual holiday plan Company Fitness plan EAP (Employee Assistant Programme) Life Assurance Plan Transportation allowance (0,21€/km regardless of the means of transport) Health Insurance – Medical Contribution Eye Examination & Computer Glasses Reimbursement Please noteWe do not offer remote working for this position Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

title: Data-analist, Houten
description: VacaturebeschrijvingEen nieuwe dag een nieuwe puzzel. Als data-analist kan een vraagstuk jou niet complex genoeg zijn. Al doe ik met die korte intro de functie zelf te weinig eer aan. Ja, het analyseren van data staat centraal, maar voor het verhaal van iedere klant en het bijstaan van je collega's heb je evenveel aandacht. Aan de hand van je ondernemende karakter onderzoek je welke in- en externe operationele processen spelen bij de klant. Is dat in kaart, volgt de analyse om uit te komen bij de optimalisaties en hoe deze uit te voeren. Wat je tussen de regels door leest? Aan verantwoordelijkheid geen gebrek. Sterker nog: je krijgt alle kans om te leren en op verschillende vlakken echt het verschil te maken voor de klant. Geen gespreide bedjes om in te stappen dus, maar elke keer nieuwe paden bewandelen en jezelf uitdagen om tot de juiste formule te komen. Waar kom jij te werken?Jij treft jouw nieuwe 'plek van bestemming' aan in Houten. Om precies te zijn bij een opdrachtgever die zich met recht een specialist mag noemen op het gebied van wagenparkbeheer en mobiliteitsmanagement. Alle zaken zo goed regelen, dat iedere klant eigenlijk vergeet dat ze over een wagenpark beschikken. Dat is waar men hier dagelijks op stuurt. Ga je hier aan de slag, krijg je er totaal zo'n 3 goedgevulde VW Polo's aan collega's bij. Allemaal met hun eigen passie voor het vak. En hoewel iedereen zijn eigen verantwoordelijkheden heeft staat het teambelang hier zeker op de kaart. Van inhoudelijke kwesties tot beleefde avonturen in het weekend, niets blijft onderling onbesproken.Echt samen gas geven dus. Een formule die alleen werkt wanneer er onderweg genoeg tijd wordt gemaakt voor onderlinge gezelligheid. Bijvoorbeeld tijdens een van de vele teamuitjes. Deze komen op de route dan ook geregeld voorbij.Hoe ziet jouw werkdag eruit?09:00 uur: na een korte dagstart met je team duik jij direct in je mailbox. Zijn er zaken die direct opgepakt moeten worden?10:00 uur: meerdere fleetmanagers weten de weg naar jou te vinden. Je helpt ze graag aan een antwoord op hun vragen en bent tussendoor bezig met het updaten van de huidige beheertool 12:15 uur: tijd voor een lekkere lunch en een wandeling buiten. Het zonnetje schijnt dus je collega's haken gezellig aan 13:30 uur: je middag staat in het teken van een klantbezoek om te inventariseren welke operationele zaken hier spelen. Pas bij het hebben van een volledig beeld bij een nulmeting is het mogelijk om na te gaan denken over optimalisaties 15:15 uur: de laatste uurtjes van je dag gaan op aan het uitvoeren van een controle op de volledigheid en betrouwbaarheid van alle ingevoerde gegevens in de beheertool17:15 uur: op naar huis (of slechts je laptop dicht doen) met een voldaan gevoel ;)Herken jij jezelf hierin?Kijk Jij In Je Achteruitkijkspiegel, Zie Jij Iemand Dieeen hbo diploma op zak heeftde Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift beheerstfulltime beschikbaar is bekend staat als gedreven, detailgericht en leergierigwoont op woon- werkafstand van Houtensnel schakelt, data driven en analytisch sterk isvoor een klant graag nog net een versnelling harder gaat PS: heb je een passie voor alles wat rijdt en ervaring binnen leasing? Dan scoor je bonuspunten.Wat krijg je ervoor terug?Eenmaal Onderweg Ben Jij O.a. Zeker Vaneen contract bij de opdrachtgever zelfvele euro's dankzij een salaris vanaf €2750.- bruto per maandminimaal 25 vakantiedagen per jaareen bonus resultaatafhankelijk is hybride werken wanneer dat je voorkeur heeft aandacht voor jouw (mentale) gezondheidvergoeding van je reiskosten wanneer je deze maakt En? Ben jij klaar om hier eens goed gas te komen geven? Solliciteer direct via de button en dan zorgen we samen zo snel mogelijk voor groen licht! 5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

title: Principal Data Analyst
description: Role - Principal Data AnalystLocation - London/ AmsterdamAbout Our Company:Elsevier helps researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. We do this by facilitating insights and critical decision-making for customers across the global research and health ecosystems. From Elsevier’s Technology function, the Research Products team collaborates across the business to drive impact. Applying customer centricity, product and data best practices, and a passion for we deliver world class customer solutions. About our teamWithin Research Products, the role of the Product Analytics team is to turn the multitude of data into insights and AB testing opportunities that can be used to build better digital products. Like us, you thrive in a complex data environment. We like getting our hands into the data, focusing on insights which drive actions and product improvements. We extract data and make sense of it using SQL, Python/R, Tableau/Adobe Analytics and quantitative techniques (such as regression, or statistical testing).How Product Analytics drives customer outcomes:Define the right metrics. Use your deep knowledge of user behavior to define performance metrics with your stakeholders that align with user success and satisfaction. For new features apply your customer centricity and business knowledge to identify and define the key metrics to evaluate product success. Collaborate with business stakeholders to define product OKRs to ensure we are focusing our efforts effectively.Measure performance. Set up dashboards and reports to track performance. Build models to understand product performance and user behavior - ultimately quantifying and communicating these insights through product metrics. Review user experience to ensure that the appropriate tagging and tracking is in place to improve our products. Create product/user funnels to understand and represent user behaviour and engagement with our products. Uncovering opportunities for new features, and collaborating with the Product Manager to define, prototype (& evaluate experiment results) and scale features & solutions. Identify and test opportunities for improvements. Grounded in deep analysis of our datasets, generate hypotheses and validate them through online experimentation and AB testing. Then deliver these together with product managers, designers and engineers. Support strategic decisions and roadmaps. Innovate and discover new insights by diving deeply into the data, combining various sources (including database and web-analytics data sources) from across the business, to support decisions and resolve strategic questions. Planning and prioritization with Product Managers. Helping them to understand which features could be built, quantify the user and business impact, and communicate these recommendations to senior leadership. Advocate Data-driven culture. Communicate insights and information effectively and engagingly, through presentations, reporting and dashboards to all levels of the organization. Advocate for a data-driven culture and help your stakeholders in how to interpret results. Empowering and enabling stakeholders across the business to make embrace the power of data and drive data informed decision making. About the role: In this role, you will lead the Product Analytics scope on one or more of our fast-growing, innovative, world-leading products, such as Interfolio, an academic faculty management software supporting interviewing, hiring, promotions and tenure.You will be responsible for establishing the product's analytics foundation and fostering a data-driven culture with the Product teams. This role offers the unique opportunity to build performance measuring and methods from scratch, shaping the product's performance, user experience, and overall business success. You will do this by leveraging your own experience, the team's experience, and the many tools we have at our disposition at Elsevier. You will be part of a large analytics team (20+ analysts) located in London and Amsterdam, working with product teams and other stakeholders across US, UK and the Netherlands.You bring: Growth Mindset. The right mix of passion, humility, positivity and desire to grow. Experience. Experience solving problems with data, collaborating with stakeholders as a data-driven thought partner. Preferred: Experience in product analytics, digital product optimization, A/B testing, and web-analytics. Demonstrable experience in data analysis and insight generation with business impact, incl. building predictive models. Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance. Technical skills. Proficiency with SQL and strong understanding of how to use data in solving problems. Preferred: Proficiency with Excel, Powerpoint, scripting (e.g., Python, R), the ability to analyze and combine large data sets in cloud data warehouse services such as Amazon Redshift (or other Postgres DB) and analytics platforms such as Databricks (Apache-Spark). Communication & Stakeholder management. Strong communicator and fluent in English (speaking and writing). Ability to communicate the findings and recommendations of analysis in a clear and effective manner at all levels, incl. experience with visual reporting and dashboarding tools (e.g., Tableau). Ability to engage with multiple stakeholders across the wider business. Preferred: Experience working cross culture and department, the ability to collaborate with stakeholders with different perspectives and priorities than yours. What we offer: At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional daysHealth screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefitsWellbeing programsLife assuranceAccess to a competitive contributory pension schemeLong service awardsSave As You Earn share option schemeTravel Season ticket loanMaternity, paternity and shared parental leaveAccess to emergency care for both the elderly and childrenRELXCARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to youAccess to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteerAccess to extensive learning and development resourcesAccess to employee discounts via Perks at Work

title: Data Analyst (Finance)
description: Data Analyst | Rotterdam Area | Renewable Energy/EV Charging | €60,000Do you enjoy working with financial data? Would you like to work in a growing company that focuses on renewable energy & EV charging? Are you looking to eventually grow into a management position and create technology strategies? If this sounds like a challenge you are seeking, then say no more! Click apply ;-).About you:3 years of experience working with Financial DataExperienced with Excel, SQL, DashboardingUnderstanding of tax & regulations (local NL laws)Nederlands spreken (mandatory)Innovative individual looking for a challenge/growthBenefits:Competitive salary40 day holidaysGreat pension planLearning & development Travel reimbursementInterviews are taking place next week!If you feel this role could be a match for you, click apply or drop me an e-mail on: Mousumi.choudhury@opusrs.com / Linkedin mail Data Analyst | Rotterdam Area | Renewable Energy/EV Charging | €60,000

title: Data Analist
description: Ben jij een gedreven en enthousiaste Data Analist met een passie voor het analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren van gegevens? Dan maken wij graag kennis met jou!Binnen Visma | Raet maken we impact. Wat hebben ziekenhuizen, overheidsinstellingen en scholen met elkaar gemeen? De kans is groot dat ze onze HR-oplossingen gebruiken. Visma | Raet is namelijk leverancier van software die het leven van HR-professionals makkelijker en leuker maakt. We helpen organisaties om medewerkers blij te maken.Zo bouw je met ons meeTer versterking van het Data Insights & Automation team zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data Analist die ons helpt om onze data driven organisatie naar het volgende niveau te tillen door gegevens te analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren. Door de samenwerking met verschillende afdelingen wordt bepaald hoe ons data platform verder kan groeien. Uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden spreken voor zich. Je presenteert jezelf sterk. Je bent alert op aspecten als kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standaarden en het afwegen van korte – en lange termijn overwegingen. Samen met collega’s onderzoek en visualiseer je data die ons helpt om doelstellingen waar te maken. Samen met onze data engineers zorg je ervoor dat de benodigde data in een bruikbare vorm beschikbaar gesteld wordt. Jullie structureren, interpreteren, documenteren en zorgen voor tests zodat de kwaliteit aantoonbaar goed is. Zo speel jij een cruciale rol in het realiseren van onze bedrijfsdoelen.Daarnaast beschik jij over:HBO of WO werk-en denkniveau;Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren en presenteren van data-analyses;Ervaring met het achterhalen van de echte behoefte achter een vraag en het vertalen hiervan naar concrete deliverables;Ervaring met datavisualisatietools (Tableau / Power BI) is een pré;Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.Dit heb je ervoor nodig en breng je meeJe beschikt over uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden. Contacten en relaties met jouw collega’s zijn essentieel voor succes en zoekt deze samenwerking dan ook op. Naast deze vaardigheden, ben je goed in:Methodische aanpak en analytische vaardigheden;Je hebt oog voor kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standards, gebruiksvriendelijkheid, afweging korte/lange termijn, onderhoudbaarheid en security;Kennis en ervaring met SQL;Agile development & Delivery practices en tools;Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift;Relational en dimensional modeling, data mapping, ETL / ELT;Opsplitsen van complexe problemen in overzichtelijke deelproblemen.Wat je ziet en wat je krijgt Je krijgt de kans om een belangrijke rol te zijn in het succes van Visma | Raet en de tevredenheid van onze klanten en medewerkers. Ook draag je bij aan het verbeteren van de huidige processen en zorgt hiermee dat we effectief blijven opereren. Ook jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling is hierin erg belangrijk. Daarom bieden we je de mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontplooien, zowel als analist als op persoonlijk vlak.Wat je van ons kan verwachtenWe vragen veel van je, maar daar staat tegenover dat je werkt met professionele, gedreven en leuke collega’s van alle leeftijden en ervaringsniveaus. Binnen Visma | Raet werken we gedeeltelijk vanuit huis. Wanneer je vanuit kantoor werkt, is dat op ons hoofdkantoor in Amersfoort met zo’n 400 andere collega’s. Je werkt binnen het Data Insights & Automation team samen met enkele business analisten en data engineers. Je werkt met mooie producten die daadwerkelijk waarde leveren voor de klanten. Uiteraard hebben we een goed inwerkprogramma voor je klaar liggen. Verder kan je verwachten:Een rol met impact in een internationale werkende, snel veranderende organisatie;Volop kansen om te groeien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak door middel van kennissessies;Een uitstekend bruto salaris tussen de €4.000 en €5.500 afgestemd op je ervaring;Een interessante bonusregeling van 2 %;Interessante vitaliteitsprogramma’s met a.s.r. Vitality;Een open en fijne cultuur met veel vrijheid en ruimte voor je eigen initiatief;Standplaats Amersfoort, goed bereikbaar met ov en auto;Laptop en telefoon van de zaak;Grote kansen op succes bij een marktleider;De mogelijkheid om flexibel en thuis te werken;Een goede thuiswerkregeling en thuiswerkvergoeding om jouw werkplek mee in te richten;28 vakantiedagen per jaar en 8% vakantiegeld;Een fulltime dienstverband.Direct solliciteren en meer weten Wil je onderdeel uitmaken van het gedreven team en druk je graag je stempel op het het succes van Visma | Raet? Solliciteer dan direct! Wil je eerst nog wat meer weten?
