Neem dan contact op met Cheryl Bihari (Talent Acquisition Partner) via cheryl.bihari@visma.com.Een online assessment en referentiecheck is onderdeel van de procedure. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld, wij vullen deze vacature in zonder tussenkomst van externe bureaus.

title: Logistics Data Analyst
description: Are you interested in inventory management? Do you want to use your analytical skills for process improvements? And do you prefer a job with growth opportunities towards Engineering or other departments? Then the position of Logistics Data Analyst is perfect for you, especially if you are just starting your career! YOUR ROLEAs Logistics Data Analyst, your goal is to maintain the customer's inventory in order. LEAN is our philosophy, and you will analyze how the processes within inventory management can be further improved. You act as an advisor to your supervisor when it comes to the way we store our inventory. Your role is to bridge the gap between the data in the Warehouse Management System and the actual operations. You will strategically assess the opportunities and bottlenecks in inventory management. This assessment will be the starting point for improvement projects that you will complete with the operation and another colleague who mainly focuses on IT-related issues. The collective goal is to make the operation more efficient, where you play a signaling and initiating role! You will work closely with the warehouse operation and supervision, which means you will also put on your work shoes and be present in the warehouse. It's a dynamic environment where you serve as a point of contact for both colleagues and the customer. Your working hours can be flexibly scheduled within office hours (between 08:00 AM - 06:00 PM). However, the operation itself is in high season open from 06:00 AM to 00:00 AM. WHAT WILL YOU DO?You will be part of the Operations Support team for an entertainment client at our warehouse location in Roosendaal. Your supervisor is the Supervisor Inventory Control, and you will have close contact with various internal departments and colleagues, such as Warehouse Supervisors, the Operations Manager, and, of course, your colleagues from the Inventory Control team. This way, you can turn daily obstacles into long-term and structural solutions. Your analyses will be based on historical data, current data, and predictive data from the customer.As a Logistics Data Analyst, you will work on:Monitoring and analyzing order flows using, for example, the ABC analysis. If there are any anomalies or deviations, you will inform the customer and/or colleagues so that appropriate actions can be taken.Identifying and contributing to the structural resolution of issues within the warehouse.Preparing the long-term (6 months) (re)organization of goods in the warehouse. WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?You enjoy optimizing processes in a large logistics environment. You are skilled in accurately processing, analyzing, and monitoring data. Moreover, you have no problem communicating with both colleagues and external parties. You are also stress-resistant and have a mindset that focuses on continuous improvement. Specifically, you bring the following knowledge and experience:Proficient in English, as many systems and communication with colleagues and the customer are in English.Strong proficiency in numerical databases (Excel and WMS system) as you will perform many analyses based on data dumps.Familiarity with the ABC analysis.At least a Bachelor's (HBO) degree level of education.Work experience is less relevant, as starters are very welcome! WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?At CEVA Logistics, there are ample opportunities to bring out the best in yourself and your career. Besides a dynamic environment where we achieve our goals together rapidly and result-oriented, we offer a position that allows room for enjoyment and connection. This role can be the first step towards a broad career path within our organization. The possibilities to chart your own course are endless!Additionally, we offer:A competitive salary ranging from € 2.316,40 to € 3.373,76 depending on your experience and educational level.A one-year contract with the possibility of a permanent contract.30 days of leave and the option to sell or buy additional leave.Profit sharing of up to 3% for positive company results.Good pension scheme, travel allowance, and 8% holiday pay.A laptop and phone.The possibility to work from home (up to 2 days based on full-time).Opportunity to participate in our CEVAfit program.A work environment where people work with passion and dedication, rewarded with food trucks, festivals, and plenty of cake!And the possibility to develop yourself through our CEVA Academy. YOUR FUTUREApply directly via the button or get in touch with Debby Bastiaansen (Corporate Recruiter) via phone number 06 - 130 273 03 (also available on WhatsApp), or email your question to ext.debby.bastiaansen@cevalogistics.com. Within CEVA, we have a driven and enthusiastic recruitment team, so if you know someone who might be suitable, let us know! We handle our recruitment ourselves, so recruitment agencies, if we need your assistance, we will contact you. #OSU

title: Data Analyst
description: Who We Are...Verra Mobility is a global leader in smart mobility. Verra Mobility Commercial Services creates smart roadways, serving the world's largest commercial fleets and rental car companies to manage tolling transactions and violations. Arizona-based Verra Mobility Corp. currently operates in 15 countries and in 22 languages.We believe there is significant opportunity to further expand into Europe. We have established our European headquarters in Amsterdam, from which we have launched our tolling and violation management solution business in Europe in 2019. We further have offices in London, Paris, Madrid, and Budapest, with a workforce of close to 100 people.Our European tolling business has established relationships with tolling authorities throughout Spain, Portugal, France, Italy and Ireland, through which we offer interoperable electronic tolling directly to consumers, through white-label partnerships and to RAC customers, depending on location.Additionally, our European violations business specializes in the identification, notification, and collection of unpaid traffic, parking and public transport related fees, charges, and penalties issued to foreign registered vehicles or persons on behalf of issuing authorities in more than 17 European countries. We provide our services in more than 20 languages and more than 10 currencies and to leverage existing connections with approximately 30 vehicle licensing authorities and over 600 toll and ticket-issuing authorities for whom we bill violators in more than 135 countries.OverviewThe Data Analyst will be responsible for creating data analytics reporting, performing business volume forecasting, and building/running ad hoc queries within the European Operations Department. The analyst streamlines processes related to collecting, processing, and analyzing data including report automation and present complex data in a simple, understandable manner to derive valuable insights. Overall, the Data Analyst plays a vital role in helping the Violations Processing, Customer Care, and Field Services departments within Commercial Services make informed decisions based on data-driven insights, contributing to the company's growth and success.ResponsibilitiesEnsure deliverables and stated objectives are met by understanding business and technical requirements.Importing, cleaning, transforming, validating, or modeling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes.Applying statistical and analytical techniques to explore and uncover patterns, trends, and relationships within the data.Creating visual representations of the analyzed data, such as scorecards and dashboards, to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.Interpreting the results of data analysis and providing actionable insights and recommendations based on the findings. Ensuring data accuracy and integrity throughout the data analysis process.Supporting data insights to increase department performance, aid in strategic planning and decision-making processes.Generating regular reports and presenting data analysis findings to management and other relevant teams.Identifying relevant patterns and information from large datasets using data mining techniques.Developing and maintaining data models to assist in analyzing complex relationships within the data.Communicate and work closely with teams to gain in-depth understanding of the daily business needs and develop reporting solutions to meet those needs.Staying up to date with the latest data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends.QualificationsBachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or engineeringMinimum 5 years directly related experience required.Proficiency in data manipulation tools and languages like SQL, Python and Excel is crucial for data cleaning, transformation, and analysis.The ability to present data effectively using tools like Tableau or Power BI is important for communicating findings to stakeholders.Familiarity with database management systems and data querying is required to retrieve and work with data efficiently.Good communication skills are essential to articulate findings and collaborate with team members and stakeholders effectively.Preferable Lean Six Sigma Green Belt. Ability to deliver results work in a fast-paced, team environment under tight deadlines.Travel required. 15% within EuropeVerra Mobility ValuesAn ideal candidate for this role naturally works in alignment with the Verra Mobility Core Values:Own It. We focus on high performance and drive toward breakthrough outcomes. Our employees ensure accountability, optimize and align work, focus on the customer, and cultivate innovation.Do What’s Right. We champion integrity and good character. Our team members model ethical behavior, demonstrate good judgment and are courageous.Lead with Grace. We express humility and compassion, and we are authentic and candid. Our employees demonstrate self-awareness, care for others, instill trust, and communicate effectively.Win Together. We believe in growing and inspiring people together. We seek people who collaborate, value differences, think and act globally, foster an engaging work environment, and recognize and develop others.With your explicit consent which you provided as part of the application process, we will retain candidate personal data solely for the business purpose for which it was collected. In no event will we retain such data more than two (2) years following the closure of the recruitment process relating to the role for which you applied or in the event other related job opportunities arise within the company. Verra Mobility Applicant Privacy NoticeVerra Mobility is an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Data Analist
description: Bij het Financieel Dagblad zoeken we momenteel een Marketing data analist die ons Data & Analytics team komt versterken. Werkend in een dynamische omgeving, ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van diepgaande analyses, het creëren van waardevolle dashboards en verschillende afdelingen meenemen en enthousiasmeren in het data geïnformeerd werken. Dit doe je voor met name voor Het Financieele Dagblad, maar ook voor BNR Nieuwsradio.Wat ga je doen...Als marketing data analist in ons D&A team werk je dagelijks nauw samen met de collega's van het marketingteam en ben jij de spil in het analyseren van marketingdata, het ontwikkelen van waardevolle inzichten voor de business en het ontwikkelen van dashboards. Je werkt aan verbeteringen in de structurering van analytische datasets binnen het centrale dataplatform om de self-service analyse en gepersonaliseerde klantbenadering op basis van audiences mogelijk te maken.Werkzaamheden zijn o.a...Diepgaande analyses uitvoeren in samenspraak met business stakeholders op gebruikersgedrag en marketingdata om de effectiviteit van campagnes te meten en proactief verbeteringen aan te bevelenHet visualiseren van de performance van diverse marketingkanalen in intuïtieve dashboards en signaleert samen met collega’s verbeterkansen met gebruik van Tableau, Looker Studio en Power PointJe weet de data te structuren, documenteren en beschikbaar te stellen voor self-service en gebruikt hierbij tools als Gitlab, BigQuery en AirflowDaarnaast ben je een sparring partner voor de marketeer om nieuwe datagedreven campagnes op te zetten met behulp van audiencesEn uiteraard begeleidt je collega’s in het gebruik van centraal beschikbaar gestelde datasets voor analytische doeleindenCultuur / het team …In het team werk je met gelijkgestemde data analisten die ieder een eigen aandachtsgebied hebben. Er wordt gewerkt met het hetzelfde dataplatform en tools, er wordt actief kennis gedeeld en we streven gezamenlijk naar verbeteringen. Het is een inspirerende omgeving waarin groei en ontwikkeling worden aangemoedigd. Binnen de organisatie heerst een informele sfeer en is er weinig sprake van hiërarchie.Dit krijg je van ons …Bij FD Mediagroep ontvang je niet alleen een competitief salaris en een aantrekkelijke winstdeling, maar ook uitstekende pensioenvoorzieningen en vooral een stimulerende omgeving voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling. Salaris tussen de 4.200,- en 5.000,- bruto voor 36 uur in de week (fulltime) exclusief 12% persoonlijk keuze budgetEen aantrekkelijke winstdelingRuime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkelingUitstekende pensioenvoorziening, met mogelijkheid voor vrijwillige eigen bijdrageDeze kennis en ervaring heb je al … Je bent een enthousiaste data analist en vindt het leuk om je te verdiepen in tooling en code op het gebied van data analyse en inrichting van het data platform. Je vindt het belangrijk dat je werk betekenisvol is voor de business en weet met je communicatieve vaardigheden goed aan te sluiten bij de vraagstukken die er liggen. Je kunt goed omgaan met veranderingen en zoekt continu naar manieren om slimmer en beter te kunnen werken, bijvoorbeeld door inzet van AI.Minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rolErvaring met SQL voor datapreparatie en transformatieErvaring met Tableau of een vergelijkbare toolErvaring met cloud data platforms, bij voorkeur Google Cloud Bekend met marketing metrics zoals CLV, churn, ARPUHet FDHet Financieele Dagblad, onderdeel van de FD Mediagroep, is dé nieuws- en inspiratiebron die op elk moment van de dag financieel-economische betekenis geeft aan ontwikkelingen in de wereld. Met het laatste nieuws, maar ook met verdiepende artikelen en altijd een blik op morgen. De kracht van Het Financieele Dagblad bestaat uit onophoudelijke en onvoorwaardelijke waarheidsvinding, respect voor de feiten en de onafhankelijkheid ten opzichte van politieke stromingen of religies en commerciële belangen. Het FD biedt onze lezers precies wat zij nodig hebben om impact te maken. We geven onpartijdige en betrouwbare informatie, duiding en achtergronden en bieden nieuwe perspectieven. We openen de deur naar een relevant netwerk en we zijn een platform voor dialoog.De toekomst wordt vandaag vormgegeven. Door mensen die zelf hun koers willen bepalen. Mensen die in een steeds complexere wereld veranderingen weten te doorgronden en zelf een verschil willen maken. Draag hieraan bij en kom werken bij het Financieele Dagblad.Bij Het Financieele Dagblad erkennen we de waarde van verschillende achtergronden, ideeën en ervaringen, en streven ernaar een werkomgeving te creëren waarin iedereen zich geaccepteerd en gewaardeerd voelt. We moedigen sollicitanten van alle achtergronden aan om deel uit te maken van ons team, omdat we geloven dat dit bijdraagt aan een dynamische en inspirerende werkcultuur.

title: Data Analyst
description: WHO YOU ARE WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN IKEA At IKEA we strongly believe that we can help people and the planet while creating an affordable and better everyday life at home. We believe that we thrive when meeting incredible people who are on the same mission at IKEA. People who are very humble, supportive, and absolutely committed to leading into the future and creating a better life for more of the many people by putting the customer and their homes at the heart of all we do. As a Data Analyst, you are an important part in guiding the organization on how to make the best use of one of the world’s possibly largest and most extensive data sets. With a growth mindset, you take ownership, enjoy collaborating with various stakeholders, including product owners and engineers, and building a network in a large organization. You focus on the customer and what the insight from the data means for them. To be successful as a Data Analyst you need to have: * Good knowledge of data mining techniques, modern visualization software (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau), or relevant domain datasets and tools for analyzing them. * Broad knowledge of data pre-processing techniques, e.g. how to handle missing data. * Broad understanding of how to leverage large datasets to improve decision-making in a business setting. * You have a passion for the possibilities of data and the value it can generate for our business. * You are motivated by continuously developing and enhancing communication skills and technical expertise. * You have a minimum of 5 years of professional experience as a Business Analyst, data/web analyst or data scientist. You also recognize yourself in some of the following: * Ability to understand the complexity of IKEA business and ability to work in the role of Data & Analytics as an integrated part. * Ability to thrive in a highly cross-disciplinary work environment, where Data, Design, Product, and Technology co-exist and deliver value as one. * Ability to perform work with a balanced trade-off between care and speed, and to understand that rapid insights may come at an initial cost of rigorousness. * Ability to turn data into insights with a compelling narrative on risk–benefit analysis. * Good written and verbal communication skills, e.g. around storytelling supported by data visualization, for a wide range of audiences * Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to drive the data needs of the business. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES As a Data Analyst, you will ensure, promote, and take responsibility for informed decision-making based on data to improve business performance as part of cross-functional digital product teams. You will also conduct advanced data exploration and analysis using modern data mining techniques (including Machine Learning), visualization tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau), or a combination thereof, to provide insights that help co-workers and stakeholders make better decisions. You will evaluate the potential and usability of pre-processed, structured internal and external data sources for use in product analytics and data-driven decision-making in general. Write demanding SQL queries that Extract, Transform, and Load data from storage to an appropriate format, using joins, nesting, and similar operations as an integral component of data processing pipelines. You also have a good knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, and with probability and statistics, a broad knowledge of SQL. Basic understanding in Agile, DevOps. ABOUT THIS WORK AREA Ingka Investments’ mission is to lead with purposeful investments, enabling Ingka Group’s long-term growth and financial strength. We want to position Ingka Group as a unique, responsible, and trusted investor. We act as a strategic partner to IKEA Retail and Ingka Centres by securing financial strength for future growth and by making investments that contribute to making Ingka Group the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer and to achieving its People & Planet Positive strategy. We can offer you: *Opportunities to have a global impact on your work * A team of great colleagues to learn together with * An environment focused on driving business and personal growth together, with a focus on continuous learning The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more about our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com. At IKEA, you’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Our different views, backgrounds, and personalities make us better understand our customers, give us more fun at work, and spark more and better ideas. Perhaps your unique take on something could lead to a great idea that creates a better everyday life for many people. QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT! You might have questions regarding the role, the recruitment process or other practicalities please get in touch with Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.ikea.com

title: Data Analyst/ Data Scientist
description: Job DescriptionMars Veterinary Health (MVH) is part of Mars Petcare, a global, family-owned business. At Mars Veterinary Health, our 70,000+ Associates are dedicated to creating A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS™. Mars Veterinary Health is a leading veterinary health provider with an international network of over 2,500 pet hospitals including BANFIELD™, BLUEPEARL™, VCA™, Linnaeus, AniCura, VSH, VES, Mount Pleasant and others across 20+ countries. We are committed to offering compassionate high-quality veterinary care, from wellness and prevention, through primary, emergency and specialty care. To learn more, visit our website or follow us on LinkedIn.AniCura is Europe’s leading provider of high-quality veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura offers a wide range of high-quality medical services covering preventive and basic health care as well as advanced diagnostics, internal medicine, intensive care, surgery, and orthopedics.Since 2018, AniCura is part of MARS Veterinary Health, a division of MARS Inc.Job Purpose/OverviewAt Mars Veterinary Health International, we are on a mission to redefine the future of veterinary care by leveraging data in unprecedented ways. We are seeking a dynamic, forward-thinking Data Analyst/Data Scientist (DA/DS) to join our vibrant team in AniCura. You will be at the forefront of all things data related, working with a team that is not just analyzing data but revolutionizing the way we operate and eventually change the lives of pets for the better. If you are passionate about data and eager to drive change, we want you on our team!The DA/DS will work to advance the data & analytics capabilities of MVHI and will be part of the D&A team at AniCura. This role will report into the Head of Data & Analytics, AniCura. This role is based in AniCura headquarters in Amsterdam, Netherlands.Key ResponsibilitiesUnlock Insights and Drive Innovation: Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect complex data sets and unveil insights that will propel our business forward.Collaborate and Influence: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven strategies that will add value.Visual Storytelling: Develop compelling data visualizations and dashboards that narrate the story behind the numbers, influencing key stakeholder decisions.Champion Data Quality: Be the guardian of data quality, ensuring accuracy and consistency, while identifying opportunities for process improvements.Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics/data science, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to our team.Job Specifications/Qualifications2-4 years of experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or consultingB.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in data analytics, statistics, economics, computer science or a similar fieldExperience with large and complex datasetsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for translating data into actionable insightsIntermediate/advanced proficiency in Power BI/Query, Python and ExcelProficiency in data analysis and querying data through Python and SQL, data modelling and machine learningFluent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishExcellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise mannerExperience working with applications like Azure Suite, Power Automate, Databricks, Alteryx, PySpark as well as a good knowledge of ETL, dataflows of data warehouses would be a plus (but no requirement)What can you expect from AniCura? Work with over 12.000 like-minded and talented Associates at AniCura and over 130.000 at Mars, all guided by The Five Principles Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together An industry competitive salary and benefits package Flexible working hours, an international and digital work environment The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our officesAbout AniCuraAniCura is present at 500 European locations in 15 countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 employees attend to more than 3.6 million companion animal patients. AniCura is a trusted training and referral body.Since 2018, AniCura is part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company with the sole objective of advancing the veterinary profession for the health and wellbeing of people, pets, and planet. Through our collective network of 2,500 veterinary clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic labs across 21 countries, we can provide the highest standards in pet care and achieve our collective Purpose: A better world for pets through Shaping the Future of Veterinary Care, together.Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data Analyst - transport Voor deze logistieke dienstverlener in Hoorn ben ik op zoek naar een business consultant. Wil en kan jij de brug slaan de tussen mens en techniek?Deze organisatie is al tijden lang actief en tevens 1 van de grootste dienstverleners in de logistiek. Zij ontzorgen hun klanten op het volledige logistieke proces. Dan moet je denken aan Transport, Warehouse, packing en consultancy. De transport sector is niet alleen op automatiseringsgebied in ontwikkeling maar ook in de duurzaamheid. Buiten een schoon wagenpark en het gebruik van alternatieve brandstoffen kijken zij ook naar het terugdringen van aantal ritjes, zuiniger rijden en moderne technieken en gebouwen.Functie-informatieOm alle bovenstaande doelen te bereiken is Data de spreekwoordelijke rode draad. Om deze data goed te kunnen analyseren dient deze data eerst goed gestructureerd te worden, opgeslagen en gevisualiseerd. Om dit allemaal te bereiken zijn nu bezig met het verder uitbouwen van het data en Bi Analysten team. Momenteel werken zij met verschillende technieken. Waaronder SQL, Tableau en Python.Functie-eisen- HBO werk en denkniveau- Affiniteit met transport- Analytisch vermogen- Kennis en ervaring met SQL, Python en tableau is een pré.- Je spreekt vloeiend NederlandsAanbod- Uitstekende primaire en secundaire voorwaarden conform de CAO- Doorgroei en ontwikkelmogelijkheden- Informele en gezellige werksfeer- Leuke uitjes en borrelsPast bovenstaande functie net niet goed bij je profiel, maar wil je wel graag in de transport sector werken? Ook dan ontvang ik erg graag je gegevens voor een vrijblijvende kennismaking.

title: Junior Data Analist, Utrecht
description: Als Junior Data Analist kom je te werken bij een overheidsinstantie verantwoordelijk is voor de veiligheid en verdediging van het land en het beschermen van nationale belangen. Het is belast met taken zoals het bewaken van het luchtruim, het handhaven van vrede en veiligheid, en het ondersteunen van internationale vredesmissies. Het ministerie speelt een cruciale rol in het waarborgen van de veiligheid van burgers en het beschermen van het land tegen externe bedreigingen. Het richt zich ook op het waarborgen van de operationele gereedheid van de strijdkrachten en het ondersteunen van humanitaire hulpoperaties, evenals het bevorderen van internationale samenwerking op het gebied van veiligheid en defensie.Binnen het expertise centrum zoekt onze opdrachtgever een professional die de data, HR, allocatie analytics en KPI’s doorontwikkelt, verandert waar nodig en altijd ‘one step ahead’ is.StandplaatsUtrecht, op kantoor en gedeeltelijk hybride vanuit huis.SalarisSalarisindicatie van €2.500,- tot €3.500,- bruto per maand. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring, met kans om door te groeien.Wij zoekenJe bent in het bezit van een hbo-diploma;Je hebt ervaring met het organiseren van een planning voor de opzet van Power BI en daarbij rekening houden met het datawarehouse en de stakeholders;Je hebt tenminste 2 jaar ervaring opgedaan met Analytics, SQL/scripting en BI tools;Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Wij biedenEen 36-urige werkweek;8% vakantiegeld;Pensioen;€50,- bruto onkostenvergoeding per maand;25 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;Abonnementsvergoeding mobiele telefoon;Status Pro Vitaal; waarbij je abonnement bij de sportschool of sportvereniging wordt vergoed ten tijde van het dienstverband.Als Junior Data Analist is het aan jou de taak om een real time presentatie op basis van KPI’s te ontwikkelen. Je helpt mee om data te verzamelen, analyseren en visualiseren, zodat de organisatie op basis hiervan beslissingen kan nemen. Je faciliteert het proces om de organisatie data-gedreven te laten werken en begeleidt de organisatie in het neerzetten en migreren naar een nieuwe BI omgeving.Sinds 2020 is de organisatie bezig om een allocatie proces voor het expertise centrum op te zetten om de producten en diensten die zij uitvoeren inzichtelijk te krijgen. Hiervoor hebben zij een allocatie tool ingericht op basis van Sharepoint en Excel. Deze allocatie tool hebben ze ingericht volgens het KISS principe. In deze allocatie wordt vraag en aanbod tegen elkaar afgezet om zo hun producten en dienstenportfolio te managen. Momenteel zijn ze bezig in Power BI hun dashboard weer te geven en een datawarehouse aan het inrichten om berekeningen uit te voeren, zodat deze in Power BI weergegeven kunnen worden. Kortom, binnen het expertise centrum zijn ze volledig Power BI aan het integreren, maar de behoefte is ontstaan door de allocatie tool.Reageer direct!Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Junior Data Analist? Graag ontvangen we je motivatiebrief en cv. Je kunt deze sturen naar via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen naar Masora Lilipaly, bereikbaar op 020-2117610.Functie-voorstelAls Junior Data Analist is het aan jou de taak om een real time presentatie op basis van KPI’s te ontwikkelen. Je helpt mee om data te verzamelen, analyseren en visualiseren, zodat de organisatie op basis hiervan beslissingen kan nemen. Je faciliteert het proces om de organisatie data-gedreven te laten werken en begeleidt de organisatie in het neerzetten en migreren naar een nieuwe BI omgeving.Sinds 2020 is de organisatie bezig om een allocatie proces voor het expertise centrum op te zetten om de producten en diensten die zij uitvoeren inzichtelijk te krijgen. Hiervoor hebben zij een allocatie tool ingericht op basis van Sharepoint en Excel. Deze allocatie tool hebben ze ingericht volgens het KISS principe. In deze allocatie wordt vraag en aanbod tegen elkaar afgezet om zo hun producten en dienstenportfolio te managen. Momenteel zijn ze bezig in Power BI hun dashboard weer te geven en een datawarehouse aan het inrichten om berekeningen uit te voeren, zodat deze in Power BI weergegeven kunnen worden. Kortom, binnen het expertise centrum zijn ze volledig Power BI aan het integreren, maar de behoefte is ontstaan door de allocatie tool.Reageer direct!Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Junior Data Analist? Graag ontvangen we je motivatiebrief en cv. Je kunt deze sturen naar via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen naar Masora Lilipaly, bereikbaar op 020-2117610.5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

title: Data Analyst - Google (junior/medior)
description: Organisatie- en afdelingsomschrijvingDeze organisatie is wereldwijd in 63 landen vertegenwoordigd. Zij mogen zichzelf dan ook dé search partner noemen van Google. Ze zijn de uitvinder van krachtige metazoekmachine-technologie. Hiermee verzamelen ze razendsnel de beste resultaten van o.a. google en Yahoo. Dagelijks helpen ze zo miljoenen gebruikers om informatie sneller en beter te vinden. Naast de zoekmachine-technologie hebben ze verschillende andere applicaties draaien. Bijvoorbeeld een bidmanagementsysteem waaraan ze continu door ontwikkelen. Iedereen denkt en werkt hier aan mee. Zeer innovatie, jonge, technische club met een alom bekende slogan "ik heb het nog nooit gedaan, dus ik kan het vast wel’’.Het team bestaat uit 25 collega’s met specialisten op het gebied van development, Data Science, Data Analysten, marketing en infra. Ze zitten in een super modern pand en bieden hiernaast heel veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Ze doen er alles aan om jou op je gemak te stellen. Ze kun je bijvoorbeeld je eigen werkplek inrichten naar je persoonlijke wensen. Ook gaan ze jaarlijks met de club wintersport en hebben ze andere leuke uitjes. De sfeer op kantoor is informeel.Functie-informatieAls data analyst werk je intensief samen met het team van business specialisten, zij voeren dagelijks aanpassingen uit om de optimale performance te behalen. Data is key hierin, daarom zul je als team elkaar van de juiste data moeten voorzien. Samen met het team onderzoek je trends, analyseert grote datasets en neem je strategische beslissingen.Functie-eisen Je beschikt over HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau. Je hebt een basiservaring als het gaat om MySQL / Python. Je bent thuis in de Google-producten zoals BigQuery en Cloud Storage. Je hebt ervaring met Google-producten zoals Google Ads / Google Analytics Je beschikt over goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal;Aanbod Salaris tussen de €3.000 - €5.000 afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring Goede bonusregeling 27 vakantie dagen Pensioenregeling TOP sfeer en TOP werkplek Ongekende uitjes

title: Junior Data Analist
description: Hoe maak jij het verschilWehkamp heeft als doel om de nummer één te worden in de hoofden en harten van alle gezinnen. Om dit te realiseren zullen we altijd precies moeten weten wie onze (potentiële) klanten zijn en hoe we ze het beste kunnen bedienen. Data staat hierbij centraal. Als Junior Data Analist zorg je ervoor dat we met de juiste analyses de customer journey van onze klanten nog beter weten te begrijpen en kunnen voorspellen.Je vindt het uitdagend om inzichten te verwerven uit de enorme hoeveelheid beschikbare data. Je bent en blijft daarbij op de hoogte van de nieuwste analysetechnieken en weet die goed toe te passen. Uiteindelijk zal je jouw data gedreven inzichten helder, concreet en dus actie gericht vertalen naar stakeholders in het bedrijf om veranderingen en verbeteringen te kunnen realiseren. Zowel proactief als op aanvraag. Voor de hele organisatie is het van groot belang de klant en dynamiek van onze categorieën goed te begrijpen; jouw inzichten spelen daarbij een grote rol!Als Junior Analist binnen onze afdeling, Marketing Analytics, ben je een belangrijk aanspreekpunt voor de collega's die zich dagelijks bezighouden met onze grote campagnes, acties, media inzet en externe klantonderzoeken. Je helpt ze inzicht te bieden in klanten, kanalen en promoties. Verder krijg je ruimte om je op verschillende aspecten van de customer journey te storten; van klanten acquisitie, kanaal- en device gebruik tot klantwaarde, loyaliteit en churn, maar ook het gedrag van onze klanten en consumenten binnen hun journey en de attributie van de verschillende online en offline mediakanalen. Je verzorgt analyses en dashboards, neemt deel in multidisciplinaire analyseteams en leert je collega’s binnen o.a. Marketing & Buying & Sales hoe beschikbare analyses te gebruiken en ondersteunt in het gebruik van visualisatie tools.Wat breng je mee en wat zetten wij hier tegenoverJe beschikt minimaal over een afgeronde WO opleiding in de richting van bijvoorbeeld Marketing Analytics of Marketing Intelligence, Econometrie of Data Science.Je hebt sterk ontwikkelde analytische capaciteiten.Je hebt affiniteit met data.Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om complexe analyses begrijpelijk actionable te presenteren. Kennis van analysetools als Databricks en Tableau is een pre. Google Analytics & Python, zijn daarbij ook belangrijk.Om succesvol te zijn in deze functie werk je graag in teamverband, toon je ambitie en neem je op basis van jouw kennis het voortouw. Hierbij verlies je het praktische en commerciële nut niet uit het oog.Wat bieden wij jou:Wij helpen jou elke dag om alles uit jouw carrière te halen. Jouw ontwikkeling en jouw persoonlijke groei zijn een wederzijdse commitment: Wehkamp groeit, jij groeit. Jij groeit, Wehkamp groeit.Salaris passend bij jouw ervaring;Vakantietoeslag van 10,5%;25 vakantiedagen;Winstdeling;Reiskostenvergoeding én een thuiswerkvergoeding;Goede pensioenregeling;Elk jaar de mogelijkheid om te groeien binnen jouw salarisschaal;Korting op jouw aanvullende zorgverzekering;Personeelskorting op nagenoeg het gehele assortiment van Wehkamp B.V.

title: Data Analist a.i.
description: Contract for 3 months|Fulltime remoteAbout Our ClientThe client is based in AmsterdamJob DescriptionThe key responsibilities are: Translating data into insights to determine the right priorities Daily KPI's Tracking Backlog Reporting to CFO Monthly DashboardingThe Successful ApplicantYou are based in EU;Experience with PowerBI & Excel;Knowledge and experience with Oracle;Excellent communication skills;You are fluent in English and Spanish;What's on Offer3-4 months contract;100% remoteFulltimeContact: Kim NguyenQuote job ref: JN-102023-6232294

title: Data Analist
description: Zorgen voor een data gedreven organisatie, waarbij je bijdraagt aan het efficiënter maken van de operationele processen en slimme inzichten biedt richting de klanten.Wat ga je doen?For this position excellent spoken and written knowledge of the Dutch language is required.PostNL Fulfilment richt zich vooral op B2C logistieke dienstverlening aan webshops (E-tailers, re-tailers, brands). De primaire dienstverlening is orderverwerking, voorraadbeheer, retouren handling in combinatie met distributie. Met ons gerobotiseerde orderverwerkingssysteem picken en verpakken we de online bestellingen van onze klanten. Als Data Analis ben je verantwoordelijk voor het initiëren, creëren en realiseren van data-gedreven inzichten. Het doel is om deze informatie in te kunnen zetten voor de operationele organisatie, het managementteam en onze klanten via de verschillende dashboards om besluiten op te vormen en te onderbouwen.Als Data Analist ben je daarnaast verantwoordelijk voor het neerzetten van een data gedreven cultuur. Je zult de verschillende afdelingen meenemen, begeleiden, coachen en enthousiasmeren in het data gedreven werken. Anderzijds initieer je zelf verbeteringen en doorontwikkelingen van de KPI’s en onderliggende drivers.Met jouw bijdrage zorg je dat de strategisch doelstelling om 100% en 24/7 inzicht te hebben in de keten gerealiseerd wordt voor klanten en ECS. Én ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten en onderhouden van logistieke calculatiemodellen ten behoeve van het afgeven van winstgevende proposities door Business Development. Jouw driver is om er voor te zorgen dat, op basis van rapportages en scherpe analyses, stakeholders gefaciliteerd worden in het maken van de juiste beslissingen.Een aantal taken die bij de functie horen zijn: Optimaliseren van rapportages en dashboards in de breedste zin van het woord voor gebruikers, andere afdelingen en het management Het verder automatiseren van data analyses en op basis van gesignaleerde verbeteringen de organisatie gevraagd en ongevraagd advies geven Meewerken aan projecten door te ondersteunen in data verwerking en het maken van scherpe analyses Bijdragen aan het uitwerken en ontwikkelen van integrale business cases (financieel, economisch, commercieel & operationeel0.Wat breng jij mee? WO werk- en denkniveau en 1 tot 2 jaar werkervaring in een logistieke omgeving is een pré; Sterke analytische vaardigheden en goed bedrijfskundig inzicht; Goed met getallen en rekenmodellen kunnen werken; Grondige kennis van Excel, Power BI, SQL, Power Query en Access; Sterk in stakeholdermanagement op alle niveaus binnen de organisatie; Sterke affiniteit met logistieke processen en operationele omgevingen; Communicatief vaardig op verschillende niveaus in Nederlands (B1)en Engels.Wat bezorgen we jou? Een uitdagende functie met doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen PostNL; Enthousiaste en gemotiveerde collega’s; De functie geeft veel zelfstandigheid en vrijheid in de uitvoering van de functie; Een inspirerende en professionele werkomgeving met veel energie; Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden op basis van de CAO PostNL De functie is gewaardeerd op schaal 10, op basis van de CAO voor PostNL: € 3.225,- tot maximaal € 5.578,- op basis van 39,25-urige werkweek.ContactVoor meer informatie over de functie en sollicitatiprocedure kun je bellen met Pim van der Velde (Recruiter) via telefoonnummer 06-23606070Wij doen de deur niet open voor ongevraagde bezorging van kandidaten voor deze functie door bureaus.Onze ambitieWe willen de favoriete bezorger van Nederland zijn door iedere dag weer bijzondere momenten te bezorgen. Daarbij staan onze medewerkers voorop en onze klanten centraal. We zoeken altijd naar manieren om het nóg beter te doen. En daar hebben we jou bij nodig.

title: Market Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a Market Data Analyst/ Business Analyst colleague to join the Market Data Analytics Team (MDAT) focused on the management of market data sourcing, transformations, models and proxies, as well as the development of dashboard and data analytics tools, forming a market data centre of excellence within TRM. We are looking for a candidate who has proven hands on experience in managing projects, analysing and visualising large sets of market data, as well as a background in Market Risk and some derivatives pricing knowledge.The TeamThe Market Data Analytics Team is part of the Traded Risk Management (TRM) department supporting a wide area of businesses within Financial Markets and Group Treasury. The Market Data Analytics team is responsible for all aspects of market data used by the TRM department including market risk, product control, and counterparty credit risk.Roles and responsibilitiesWorking closely with the TRM teams to understand and deliver on their market data requirementsCoordinating and implementing market data used in market risk-related internal initiatives as well as upcoming regulatory changes, such as the market data components of the valuation risk programBeing a point of contact to resolve market data queries from our stakeholders including Trading, Risk and Model ValidationWorking closely with Model Validation to close out market data related findingsCo-ordinating agile projects with IT developers and system support teams to develop and maintain high market data quality standards on behalf of TRMDeveloping and maintaining derived market data and proxy models for multiple asset classesConducting analysis on large data sets, processes and technology systemsDaily market data validation & reporting, defined by the Market Data Replacement & Proxy PolicyCollaborating with the global team across the full market data lifecycle including requirements, architecture, implementation, testing, and release managementHow to succeedWe hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.Qualification/EducationEssential: Graduate in finance or another quantitative subjectDesirable: Professional qualification (e.g., PRM, FRM)Experience/KnowledgeEssential: At least 5 years of experience in a Market Risk or Product Control function.DesirableExperienced professional or business analyst in risk management within large, internationally active financial institutionsGood quantitative level of experience with various products and their risksExperience with and keen interest in financial markets relevant policies, guidelines and regulationsGood quantitative level of experience with several asset classes, their risks and pricingAdvanced level understanding of quantification of market risk metrics (VaR, HVaR, IRC, etc.) and market risk capital requirementsExperience in dealing with large market data sets and associated technology with a working knowledge of SQL and PythonExperience with systems such as Summit, Murex, Bloomberg, Markit, Reuters, ActivePivot.is also a plusPersonal CompetenciesEssentialStrong communication skills: Position involves regular interaction with colleagues in varying degrees of seniority and understanding of new rules and processes. Candidate should be able to adapt communications to target audiences ranging from senior executives to junior colleagues involved/impacted by new rules and processesSelf-starter, result-driven and flexible, i.e., able to adjust quickly to new circumstancesMust be capable of working very productively and independently using time very efficiently.Team player with a mindset of empowering othersDelivery focusedHands on approach with good analytical skillsProfessional and confident mannerGood verbal and written communication skillsOrganised and detail orientatedFluent in EnglishRewards and benefitsWe want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htmThe Benefits Of Working With Us At ING Include A salary tailored to your qualities and experience 24-27 vacation days depending on contract Pension scheme 13th month salary Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary 8% Holiday payment Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities An informal working environment with innovative colleagues About usWith 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.Questions?Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

title: E-Commerce (Data Analytics) Intern
description: Duration: 6 monthsStarting date: January 2024Students have to be enrolled in a university for the entire duration of the internship.HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?Are you passionate about e-Commerce? Are you inspired by the Maisons such as Cartier, IWC, Van Cleef & Arpels, Vacheron Constantin, Piaget, Panerai & Jaeger-Lecoultre? Are you driven by using data, analyzing data and creating insights from data?Then join our dynamic e-Commerce & CRC team! As our new intern, you will support the development of our e-Commerce business. You will gather, validate and analyze data, to support the e-Commerce Data and Operations specialist in creating the best insights and analysis to improve the business. You will collaborate with Brands e-com managers in collecting data to build operational plans. You will be responsible for maintain and further developing existing dashboards Your data insights will help making the right management decisions to develop the company. You will gain understanding of e-commerce, improving and end-to-end mapping e-com processes.Key Responsibilities & DutiesPrepare trend analyses and presentations.Analyze business performance and provide recommendations to the business on improvement opportunities. Support analytical requests for business cases.Provide data insights for defining annual KPIs and strategic targets.HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?By being yourself and showing your passion for an exceptional customer experience, while demonstrating a pragmatic yet flexible attitude.You are currently enrolled in an Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in data science, Mathematics, E-commerce, Economics, Operations Management, Supply Chain or Business Administration, or related technical University program and are you available full-time, as of January/February, for a period of 6 or 12 months. You have strong written and verbal communication skills in English. With your strong analytical skills, you are an excellent organizer and enjoy driving change. Ability to manipulate and condense large volumes of data into succinct and powerful visualizations (graphs, charts, diagrams, dashboards, pivot tables).Excel and MS Office are second nature to you, BI/Data Analysis knowledge is a plus.Knowledge of a least one programming language (Python, R, etc.)While coordinating the different tasks, you like to take initiative and are pro-active. You are positive about your work and able to transmit this positivity to your colleagues, fostering a strong team-spirit.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About us; iconic brand, tiny companyPolaroid was founded in 1937 by one of the most seminal innovators of the 20th century, Edwin Land. His motto was, “don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible.” In 2008, Polaroid shuttered its last factory, but a group of diehard fans came together as The Impossible Project to save instant film. Over 10 years later that start-up acquired what was left of Polaroid and today we’re again a small group of people passionate about empowering creators to change the world in the name of Polaroid.What we are building; tools for creatorsThroughout its 80-year history, Polaroid was at its best when we made tools for people to express themselves, push boundaries and move culture forward. In the next decade, we are getting back to this purpose. We're not solving small problems, and we're not addressing a small market; our goal is to make products that will make the world more meaningful and human.The roleWe are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled individual to lead our digital analytics implementation and manage our customer data platform (CDP) initiatives. This dual role requires expertise in setting up, maintaining, and troubleshooting web analytics tracking systems, along with engineering and integrating customer data platforms.Responsibilities:1. Implement, manage, and troubleshoot web analytics tracking systems using tools like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.2. Collaborate with various teams to understand their tracking and data needs, ensuring accurate and effective implementation.3. Test, validate, and debug tracking setups to ensure data accuracy and integrity.4. Identify and resolve tracking, data integrity, and CDP-related issues.5. Design, deploy, and manage CDP systems to centralize customer data, ensuring it's accessible and actionable for marketing initiatives.6. Assist in setting up and maintaining Google Analytics accounts, views, properties, Google Tag Manager containers, tags, and CDP integrations.7. Create and maintain technical documentation related to web analytics tracking implementation and CDP processes.8. Assist in data analysis, report generation, and offer insights from both web analytics and CDP data.9. Train team members on tracking tool setup, CDP usage, and best practices.10. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.Requirements:1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field plus 3 years commercial experience2. Proven experience in implementing and maintaining web analytics tracking systems and CDP platforms.3. Strong understanding of digital marketing, web analytics, and customer data management.4. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, and relevant CDP technologies.5. Familiarity with data layer concepts, structures, and data integration methodologies.6. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Preferred:1. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and major CDP platform certifications.2. Experience with other tag management systems, web analytics tools, and CDP integrations.3. Knowledge of SEO, SEM strategies, and data privacy regulations.If you apply for a position at Polaroid, we will process your personal data. Please see our Job Applicant Privacy Policy for more information about how we handle personal data of job applicants. https://www.polaroid.com/privacy-policy

title: Data Engineer
description: Working at the heart of the energy transition and supporting the terminals to become a data-driven organization.is well underway to become a digital and data-driven organization. We are investing heavily in the data foundation as well as speeding up the utilization of data. For years, we have been standardizing our business processes across our terminal network, modernizing our application landscape, started governing and modelling our data, and implementing new cloud-based integration-, and data analytics platforms. More and more data is utilized in customer portals, data sharing platforms with partners in the logistic supply chain, and for advanced analytics & AI.In a brand new department within Global IT, the Data and Analytics Office, all data capabilities needed to support the data journey are centralized, ranging from Data Engineers & Data Scientists to Data Quality experts and Data Architects.As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the preparation and delivery of our data towards our data consumers, including collection/ingestion and integration of data from various internal and external data sources, into the different data stores and systems optimized for reporting and analytics. Examples are our cloud-based data lake (AWS S3), enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake) and data virtualization & catalogue (data. world).Furthermore, we are in the process of implementing an ambitious data analytics architecture, where we are translating our business strategy and requirements to new data technologies.One of your first assignments will be the migration of our current data integration solution into a modernized data integration technology.We are looking for a (medior) Data Engineer to help us in our journey towards becoming a data-driven company.RequirementsAs a data engineer, you will:Develop and maintain data pipelinesManage our data lake for reporting purposesBuild collectors (Lambda, DMS, Spark or Glue) and processes in AirflowConfigure and manage tools like Cloudformation (CDK)Use support tooling such as Gitlab (CI/CD)Focus on the technical implementation of use cases and required tools on a new data platformBe involved in the data standards and initiatives that we have set for our customersIn this role, you have the autonomy to, together with your team, decide how to maintain the data lake as you want it. You will be working with a variety of use cases and different data sets and will be continuously working on maintaining and keeping the platform alive. The report that you will deliver have an impact: they are used for sales and forecasting reports and enable our colleagues to work efficiently. You will be taking on various cases, as well as finding answers to questions like these:How can we incrementally develop a data platform that enables the most optimal development of use cases?How can we most efficiently develop a use case on the data platform and incrementally enhance the data platform to accommodate new use cases from our colleagues and our organization?

title: Data Engineer
description: At D2X we are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Amsterdam office. Are you a problem solution-seeker and do you have a genuine desire to craft clean and correct code? Then keep reading!About D2XAt D2X we are driven to become the first regulated derivatives exchange for the digital asset industry in Europe. Our mission is to bridge the gap between Tech and Finance and to facilitate the institutional adoption of digital assets through derivatives. We recently raised our seed funding round, and we are looking for exceptional talents with an entrepreneurial drive and an interest in the digital asset space to join our fast-growing team.Working for D2X means being independent, creative, and adaptive. Our culture of innovation and accountability creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career.Technology at D2XDigital assets trade round-the-clock, 365 days a year. Therefore, we are constantly seeking the most advanced technology to offer a fast and reliable trading interface. Rust allows us to achieve that in a productive way. Developing, testing and optimizing our codebase is the bread and butter of our Engineers.Your ResponsibilitiesData Pipeline Development: Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of financial data from various sources, including market data feeds, trade records, and user activityData Modeling and Warehousing: Develop and optimize data models and data warehousing solutions to support real-time and scheduled analytics, reporting, retention and business intelligence needsScalability and Performance: Architect and manage systems that can handle high-frequency trading data, ensuring low latency and high availability through stages in entity lifetimesInfrastructure Management: Manage and improve data storage, processing, and analytics infrastructure, running both on-premises and in the cloud (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and resolve data pipeline issues and performance bottlenecksSecurity and Compliance: Ensure data security and compliance with industry and regulatory standardsRequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related fieldProven experience (5+ years) as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environmentStrong knowledge in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousingExperience with real-time data processing and streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka, Flink)Proficiency in SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)Knowledge of financial markets and trading systems is a plusExperience with a Systems Programming Language (e.g. C, C++ or Rust)Excellent problem-solving and communication skillsExperience working collaboratively in a fast-paced, startup environmentBenefitsEnergetic, Collaborative & Fun Work environmentGenerous base salary compensation with bonus post-launchStock Option PlanBike compensated by the company, up to EUR 749Gym membership, up to EUR 35Dynamic, international, innovative, and respectful work environment – employees are at the core, we value every person and encourage initiativePremium office space with rich amenities in AmsterdamHybrid working mode with 4 days a week at the office and 1 day a week from homeWe welcome applicants from all over the world. We believe in diversity and inclusivity and are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all of our employees. We will support the right candidate with their visa application process. Where applicable, we will provide assistance with the 30% ruling application to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.Are you up for the challenge? We would love to get to know you! Apply directly here: https://d2x.bamboohr.com/careers/55

title: Analytics Engineer
description: You support your team through your technical expertise and passion for data. Together with your team, you build amazing data products that provide important insights to Coolblue, so everyone can make better and educated business decisions.How do I become a Analytics Engineer at Coolblue?You work in a multi-functional team, collaborating with other Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers and Analysts, to provide insights that support strategic decision-making across your domain.You play a key role in building complex data products by combining and transforming raw data into insights, while applying software engineering best practices in handling analytics code base. You publish and share these products and make them easy to access by keeping an updated data catalog and implementing data governance. Your efforts ensure data consistency, reliability, and accessibility across the organization.Share your knowledge and passion for data analytics with colleagues. You'll be instrumental in fostering a culture where data-driven decision-making is the norm, not the exception.You are confident in your skills, in particular in SQL and Data Modeling, and you use all opportunities to coach your colleagues about those topics. Would you also like to become an Analytics Engineer at Coolblue? Read below if the job suits you.You enjoy doing thisTransforming complex data into meaningful insights by working alongside business teams, understanding their needs, and delivering data-driven insights that help them achieve their goals.Organizing data, ensuring it's easily accessible. Your work with data catalogs and governance frameworks ensures that data is reliable, consistent, and readily available for analysis.Spreading your knowledge in data analysis, cultivating a data-driven mindset throughout the organization.You are always eager to learn new tools and techniques in analytics and business intelligence, keeping Coolblue at the cutting edge of data-driven decision making.You recognize yourself in the followingYou have 3+ years of experience working as data engineering or in a technical data analytics role.You have experience with SQL and a programming language, preferably Python.You are able to work with dbt in cloud environments such as BigQuery, Snowflake or Redshift.You have a solid understanding of data warehousing, orchestration, pipeline and visualization solutions.You have knowledge about visualization tools such as Looker.You have excellent communication skills and the ability to adjust your message to different audiences.This is what you’re looking for in a jobMoney.Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.Travel allowance and a retirement plan.25 leave days. As long as you promise to come back.Travel allowance, a pension plan and where-you-work-money.A discount on all our products.Relocation assistance: from A to Z. We will make sure it goes well and give full support. An extraordinarily good work environment with colleagues from all over the world who make you happy, epic Coolblue parties, pubquizzing, and other activities.Room for new initiatives and ideas. We’re always open to those, whether you’ve been with us for a week, a month, or a year.A job at one of the fastest-growing companies in the Benelux.A picture-perfect office at a great location. You could crawl to work from Rotterdam Central Station. Though we recommend just walking for 2 minutes.At this moment we have a hybrid way of working: a combo between working from home and at the office. Of course we take care of a home office supplies. Including a desk chair, laptop and blue colored decoration.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Analytics Engineer at TransferzTransferz operates a global marketplace for ground transportation, dedicated to travellers, travel brands, and transfer companies. Travellers can complete their travel plans with door-to-door transfers by selecting the transfer they want, based on vehicle type and price, and enjoy peace of mind on the first and last mile of their journeys. With coverage in 150+ countries, 800+ airports and more than 1.500 transfer companies in the network, Transferz is truly global. We have the ambition to become the market leader in ground transportation worldwide.Transferz is seeking a talented Analytics Engineer to join our Product/IT department. As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to drive business decisions and improve our products.In this role, you will work closely with our international teams to streamline the data warehousing, develop data models, and create visualizations that provide insights into KPIs and product performance. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable reports and dashboards.Our ideal candidate has a strong analytical background and is fluent in SQL. Knowledge of python is an advantage. In addition, We’re looking for someone that has experience with querying and modelling relational databases, as well as Google BigQuery or other Cloud-based data warehouses. To help us further up our data game, strong data visualisation skills are also required for this role.Responsibilities:Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insightsDevelop and maintain data models and databasesCreate and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicatorsCollaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirementsProvide data-driven recommendations to improve product performanceStay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analyticsWe can offer you:a place where you can be yourself and grow your skills; we personalize your learning trajectory based on your desired outcome!a great working atmosphere with driven and ambitious peers;all the tools you’ll need to excel; both hardware and software;a vibrant new office in Amsterdam with a global impact on ground transportationan entrepreneurial environment where the sky is the limit!We believe it’s the people that make the business and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us in creating an open, transparent, motivating, inspiring, and fun working environment. We have a typical scale-up culture, growing fast, hard-working, and have huge ambitions. But no worries, work hard = play hard!With truly global coverage, Transferz is a multilingual and multinational company and believes in fostering diversity. We are headquartered in Amsterdam with an additional office in Cordoba (Argentina), and presence in Bangkok.Want to join the ride? Apply now and get onboard!You have around 2+ years of work experience in a similar roleYou have excellent SQL skills (GoogleBigQuery / PostgreSQL are a pre)You have strong data visualisation skillsYou have experience with dashboard tools (Looker or similar BI tools) and relational database modelingYou have very analytical and good problem-solving skillsYou have empathy, curiosity, and a data mindset for understanding and addressing complex issuesYou have affinity with statistics and hence understanding when analysis or models are significant (CI, distributions and distance measures)

title: Founding Analytics Engineer
description: Increment is building a Data Cloud Optimisation product, helping data teams understand the cost of their data workloads and helps them take the right actions towards optimising those costs. We're building an interpretation engine that pulls in metadata and transforms it into actionable recommendations and granular insights. We're looking for someone who can help us develop our foundational cost optimisation model. What you'll doIncrement is taking a unique approach towards cloud optimisation. Modern cloud platforms, like Google BigQuery, come with a usage based pricing model where they charge for every byte that you process or store. Using the platform metadata, we build a bottoms up cost model, enabling cost insights at the most granular level (SQL/Table level).Then we apply a combination of advanced analytics engineering, SQL parsing, and LLM's to create highly relevant, and actionable cost savings recommendations with clear effort and ROI labels.In this role, you'll be working closely with the founder to build up this model and the surrounding technologies. What you'll need? At least 6 years experience in a data role, of which the last 2 in analytics engineering A deep understanding of the Google Cloud Platform, especially BigQueryExcellent understanding of data modelling frameworks and paradimes Understanding of SQL Query execution plans Expert in SQL, highly proficient in PythonYou're an innovative problem solverYou're a great communicator

title: Data Engineer
description: Growth Accelerator is seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure and systems that enable efficient data processing and analysis.Responsibilities:Design and implement data pipelines, ETL processes, and data integration workflowsBuild and maintain scalable data systems for storing and retrieving large volumes of dataEnsure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation and cleansing processesCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers, to identify data requirements and develop solutionsOptimize data storage and retrieval for performance, scalability, and cost-effectivenessMonitor and troubleshoot data pipelines and systems to ensure optimal performance and availabilityRequirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar roleProficient in SQL and Python. Experience with other programming languages is a plusExperience with data engineering tools and frameworks such as Apache Hadoop, Spark, and KafkaKnowledge of database design, data modeling, and data warehousing conceptsFamiliarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or AzureStrong problem-solving and analytical skillsExcellent communication and collaboration abilitiesRequirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role Proficient in SQL and Python. Experience with other programming languages is a plus Experience with data engineering tools and frameworks such as Apache Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka Knowledge of database design, data modeling, and data warehousing concepts Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent communication and collaboration abilities

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Analytics Engineer***Salary depends on level of experience***Amsterdam, NL Want to work for a client who strives to use their professional abilities to help their clients analyze customer data and act on the results? Then this company is the one for you! THE COMPANYThis client is one that makes sure their company is data-driven effectively for their clients through the talents of their colleagues. They use their data, having collected it in the way the client wants, and give valuable insights in order to improve clients’ customer experience and conversion. Want to improve your business and monitor customer response that’ll work out in your favor? This client is one for you! THE ROLEAs this client’s Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for accurate data collection and interpretation of the data. You will be working alongside clients as well as colleagues, helping them with their web tagging whilst feeling comfortable using JavaScript to solve issues. You will be always coming up with new solutions whilst working with Adobe, Google, Tag Management and data layers implementing them into your work. Need to take on challenged for organisations for commercial clientsSufficient knowledge of JavaScriptWill have to work with Google and Adobe Analytics tools as well as Tag ManagementYou will always be up to date on the developments within this fieldMust be eager to learn and always busy with your own developmentsYou should like to share your knowledge with your colleagues YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCESExperience as a Technical Web Analyst/Analytics EngineerHave experience in Google and/or Adobe Analytics toolsExperience with JavaScript, can check whether codes work correctly and analyze themMust have experience with Tag Management systems making you familiar with data layers, triggers/load rules and configuring tagsExplain complex technical matters in a clear wayYou will find/create a good atmosphere at work THE BENEFITSAn annual contract that can be extended indefinitelyWorking from home including budget for your home officeYou get given a work laptop by the companyYou have the ability to work 32, 36 or 40 hours per week27 vacation days (based on a 40-hour working week)Travel card for professional and personal use HOW TO APPLYPlease register your interest in this Analytics Engineer role by applying via this website. For more information on this role or other roles in the Marketing and Insights market, reach out to Poppy Vaughan at Harnham.

title: Data Engineer
description: Voor onze opdrachtgever, zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Azure data-engineer om deel uit te maken van hun team.Ben jij een enthousiaste tech-avonturier die klaar staat om grenzen te verleggen? Wil je je aansluiten bij een bont DevOps-gezelschap dat cloudgoeroes, data-tovenaars, en risico & security superhelden verenigt om risico en beveiliging samen te brengen binnen een toonaangevende overheidsorganisatie?Over de Rol:Als Azure data-engineer ben je gepassioneerd over werken met data. Jouw ultieme doel is om schone en bruikbare data beschikbaar te stellen voor cruciale overheidsinitiatieven. Je hebt oog voor technische details en fungeert als gesprekspartner voor diegenen die afhankelijk zijn van data binnen deze overheidsorganisatie.Omdat data zelden "kant-en-klaar" beschikbaar is en in diverse formaten wordt aangeboden, voel jij je helemaal thuis in data-assessment en data-voorbereiding. Je bent bekend met verschillende dataopslagmogelijkheden en methoden om deze te ontsluiten. Het werken met moderne Cloud-omgevingen (MS Azure) en open-source data is voor jou vertrouwd. Als Azure data-engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor:Het zoeken, ontsluiten en beschikbaar stellen van datasets.Het beoordelen van de datakwaliteit van externe bronnen.Het ondersteunen van gebruikers bij het gebruik van data.Het adviseren en implementeren van oplossingen voor complexe datamodellen en data-analyses met behulp van cloud-technologie (Azure).Het leveren van hoogwaardige dataverwerkingssoftware en minimalisatie van technische schulden.Een actieve bijdrage aan het multidisciplinaire DevOps-team en de verdere ontwikkeling van DevOps-praktijken binnen deze overheidsorganisatie.Jouw Profiel:Minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring in dataverwerking.Kennis en ervaring in het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en beheren van ETL-processen.Aantoonbare werkervaring met operationele datamanagementactiviteiten, Business Intelligence en Data Warehouse-omgevingen.Kennis van Data Lake- en Data Warehouse-patronen en methodieken.Kennis en ervaring met Microsoft SQL Server en Azure Cortana Intelligence Suite.Het Aanbod:Een 36-urige werkweek (inclusief 13e maand en vakantiegeld).199,5 vakantie-uren per kalenderjaar (boven op je standaard wekelijkse roostervrije dag).Thuiswerkvergoeding voor de dagen waarop je vanuit huis werkt.Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een fiets- en deviceregeling en een vergoeding voor de inrichting van je thuiswerkplek.Een competitief salaris (uiteindelijke inschaling is onder meer afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring).Powered by JazzHRwmjGcrYh9M

title: Data Engineer
description: ALL DATA ENGINEERS BASED IN EUROPE BEWARE!Put your technological skills to work for a sustainable future!We are looking for a driven data engineer who wants to make the move to a growing and ambitious organisation. This organisation is dynamic and offers many opportunities to develop yourself. You will work in various teams of data engineers, but you focus on your own range of tasks. This makes your contribution and impact visible.In your work as a data engineer, you will work with technologies and methodologies such as Snowflake, DBT, Databricks, Python, AWS, Terraform, Kafka, PySpark. Your tasks will include optimising data pipelines and providing insight into customers' energy consumption. Work will be divided into three-week sprints and quarterly pi's. This also contributes to developing and improving you as an individual.What they offer you: Permanent contract with a monthly salary up until 7500 gross per month, depending on your seniority level;Secondary benefits (laptop, phone, NS Business Card, etc.)30 Holiday days because you have other hobbies besides your work;A bonus opportunity to express our appreciation even more;Hybrid working including associated home working allowance;Room for growth and development, within and outside your area of expertise;Within walking distance of Den Bosch Central Station.The ideal candidate will have: Minimum three years' experience as a Data engineer;Experience with AWS cloud services;Experience with distributed computing frameworks such as PySpark or Snowflake;Experience implementing CI/CD pipelines and automated testing;Experience with SQL and relational databases.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: Vattenfall is een Europees energiebedrijf met ongeveer 20.000 werknemers werkzaam in diverse landen. Al meer dan 100 jaar houden we ons bezig met het electrificeren van industrieën, het leveren van energie aan de huizen van mensen en het moderniseren van onze manier van leven door innovatie en samenwerking. Vattenfall wil een fossielvrij leven mogelijk maken binnen één generatie. We lopen voorop in de transitie naar een duurzaam energiesysteem.
