In this role, you would serve as a trusted partner for regional Creative Production leadership. Given this data & insights-rich landscape, we are looking for a highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to partner with teams and product managers. This is an opportunity for you to have direct influence on strategic decisions through technical and thought partnership that will ultimately shape promotional content.As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will…As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be partnering with a diverse range of cross-functional partners to uncover new opportunities, design, execute, and analyze experiments, and deliver solutions that have a significant impact and implications for our usersYou will help drive innovations through effective identification and application of analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learningThis is a high-impact role in which you will have a direct influence on how product decisions are madeEffectively identify and apply analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learning techniques for given problemsLead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments Proactively perform data exploration on engagement behaviors to discover future opportunitiesIdentify, compute and validate the appropriate metrics to measure success in a product areaCultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etcYou are…Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field5+ years relevant experience with large scale dataStrong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation or other product analytics settingsStrong product knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in consumer/ or user interface settings or internally serving technical audiences such as engineersDemonstrated ability to communicate and drive product changeStrong SQL skillsStrong Quantitative Programming skills in Python or RAbility to work independently and drive your own projectsAbility to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at many different levelsPlus: Experience in building real-world machine learning models with demonstrated impactPlus: Experience creating data products and dashboards such as TableauPlus: Experience in building causal inference solutionsPlus: Familiarity with software engineering practice and working with APIsNetflix culture resonates with youCultureYou will have the opportunity to impact in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence decision-making in a fast paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Science Analyst
description: Who We AreAdaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support the SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in all industries, across markets, and throughout their entire value chains.Adaptfy is also a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis is an embodiment of visionary thinking in the digital world. SHV is a globally established family of companies centered around the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.SHV's history is evidence of their courage to care for people, for business performance, and for generations to come. Their success is a testament to their constant re-invention through innovation.Adaptfy plays a pivotal role in bringing the innovation and the digital vision to life for all the SHV Groups across the world. We connect the dots for SHV, shaping the data-driven future for the whole family of companies.What We OfferInteract with our clients on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change. Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues. A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career. Become part of a fast growing international and diverse teamWhat you will doPerform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics. Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc. Communicate analyses via compelling presentations. Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis Prepare and facilitating workshops Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives Coach and mentor team membersWhat You’ll Bring1-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain. An advanced degree in quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, etc.). An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis. Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or Matlab. Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics. Profound knowledge of the English language.

title: Data Scientist
description: Hungry for a challenge?That’s good, because at Just Eat Takeaway.com (JET) we have abundant opportunity or as we say, everything is on the table. We are a leading global online food delivery marketplace. Our tech ecosystem connects millions of active customers with hundreds of thousands of connected partners in countries across the globe.Our mission? To empower every food moment around the world, whether it’s through customer service, coding or couriers.All About The RoleAs Data Scientist you will be focussing on delivering new and improving existing machine learning applications for a variety of sales operations at Just Eat Takeaway.com. You will help drive better restaurant recommendations, more accurate delivery estimates, operational improvements, and better experiences for our customers, restaurants and drivers.Our Functional Sales analytics team operates as a center of excellence, and as such you will be collaborating with departments and functions across the whole company. You are an expert in Machine Learning and will share and develop your expertise together with the wider data science community where best practices are adopted. You'll work on projects side by side with Data Scientists from other departments, other times you will collaborate directly with our business stakeholders - depending on what is needed to make a business impact. In this role you will also work with our ML engineering team to shape our Machine Learning platform, which enables us to perform advanced analytics in a streamlined manner across the company.You will be part of the Functional Sales team which is part of the Sales Strategy and Operations organisation, and you will report directly to our Manager of Sales Analytics.In this role, you will also have the opportunity to:Lead and deliver data science projects from start to finish, working closely with stakeholders to ensure a measurable business impactGuide and coach junior team members to help them develop their data science skillsIdentify improvement opportunities across the data science landscape, proactively advising the team on this and taking action as needed to prevent and fix critical problems across our ML solutions with the wider team.Consult with stakeholders on data and technical issues, providing guidance on technical implementation feasibilityDevelop guidelines, best practices and drive adoption throughout the data science communityBe an active participant in the community for all data scientists and data engineersCan you deliver…Here are the skills we need from our Data Scientist:3+ years’ experience working in data scienceProven record of applying statistical and machine learning methods to solve real-world problems in a scalable way, ideally in a production-grade environment. Example methods include forecasting, anomaly detection, classification, personalization, ranking, recommender systems, and dynamic pricingDelivering data-driven insights and outcomes clearly and communicating effectively with people of varying levels of data literacy and technical knowledgeAbility to collaborate with stakeholders across different organizations and geographies to define the work and deliver initiativesConfident in extracting and manipulating data from various SQL and NoSQL data stores (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Cassandra) and platforms (Airflow, Spark, Kafka) in a cloud environmentAbility to develop confidently in Python. This doesn't mean hacking in Jupyter, we need people with a passion for software, who can read and understand complicated codebasesExperience working in agile teams with code reviews and source control is preferredAt JET, This Is On The MenuOur teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.Inclusion, Diversity & BelongingNo matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.What else is cooking?Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: What are you going to do?Are you ready for a data challenge? Enza Zaden is currently on a mission to be the most data savvy and data driven breeding company in the world and therefore we’re looking for you, a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer. You will be responsible for bringing data science models into production and building and maintaining the data science platform to enable data-users to create business value.Inside Enza Zaden, the ML engineering team works with Azure ML including common programming languages (Python and R), so it’s important that you know your way around with these products. You will design, develop, build, test and maintain a stable data science platform that reside on the central Enza Zaden data platform. Your challenge is to standardize and automate data science services and products as much as possible with an agile mindset for all AI-using departments of Enza.Furthermore, you will continuously improve the data science services to guarantee the optimal usage of the platform (e.g., reliability, efficiency and quality) and make sure the AI production models stay future proof (life cycle management, model drift and other ML Ops activities). Next to that, you’re monitoring the usage and costs of the data science platform. Together with the other ML engineers within Enza you make sure the data science products apply to the security (e.g., user and data access management) and standards of Enza Zaden together with the architecture department.Moreover, you are communicatively strong to give support and advice to the data scientists about the optimal usage of the data science products and best practises. Finally, you like to share, educate and inform other data science professionals and stakeholders about the data science platform, services and tooling. You keep yourself up to date with trends and developments.Your PowerIn our professional team full of passionate engineers, we are looking for a ML Engineer who has multiple years of experience with productionizing data science models (ML Ops).To Meet The Job Requirements, Youunderstand how data science projects are executed (CRISP-DM).know how to set up data science pipelines.have experience with data science frameworks (such as TensorFlow or Pytorch).have both knowledge of software and data engineering.have the ability to teach and coach fellow (junior) team members.are able to communicate both with business and data professionals.are a team player.are proficient in English, both written and verbal.TechnologiesMicrosoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Fundamentals (AI-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102)Azure MLDatabricksR and/or PythonGitDockerOur powerEnza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties and produces and sells its seeds all over the world. The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. Our new varieties help feed the world's growing population, knowing that there is less available land for growing and poorer climate conditions. The challenging AI projects we work on contribute directly to these objectives.With more than 2500 passionate colleagues all over the world, we work together every day on the vegetables of tomorrow. Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning or visit our profile page on LinkedIn.ContactNick van DijkCorporate Recruiter+31 6 1544 5587n.vandijk@enzazaden.nl

title: Data Scientist
description: Role -Data ScientistLocation - Utrecht, NetherlandsJob Description: STEM education, with a preference for econometrics or mathematics.Experience with Python, knowledge of Java and PySpark is an advantage.Experience with data and data products (e.g. data management, data analyses, artificial intelligence, machine learning, forecasting, dashboaring).Knowledge and experience within the financial sector and specifically in the field of the Customer Integrity domain is an advantage for those moving up.

title: Data scientist ethiek
description: Analytics, AI en algoritmen zijn niet meer weg te denken uit het werk van de Belastingdienst. Maar hoe ga je op een ethische manier met al die gegevens om? Je wilt bijvoorbeeld niet dat iemand wordt uitgesloten op basis van een algoritme. Dat is jouw verantwoordelijkheid als data scientist ethiek in Utrecht.Dit doe je bij de BelastingdienstJij bent onderdeel van het ethiekteam van Datafundamenten & Analytics (DF&A). Hier ontwikkel je methodes om onze modellen te toetsen op vooroordelen en rechtvaardigheid. En om de eventuele vooroordelen (bias) weg te nemen. Je doet zelfstandig literatuuronderzoek en vertaalt dit naar praktisch bruikbare methodes. Ook speel je een grote rol in het uitvoeren van bias- en fairnesstoetsingen. En je communiceert duidelijk over de resultaten in presentaties en rapporten. Zo breng je ethiek en techniek samen.In jouw functie werk je veel samen met de ethiek officer, adviseur ethiek en de rest van het ethiekteam. Samen maken jullie het ethiekbeleid praktisch toepasbaar binnen DF&A. Daarnaast begeleid en inspireer je collega’s op het gebied van ethiek. Hierdoor kunnen zij de bias- en fairnessroetsingen zoveel mogelijk zelf bewaken in het ontwikkelproces. Daarnaast speel je ook een belangrijke rol in het vertalen van de resultaten en analyses richting de stakeholders. Daarbij overtuig je zowel je team als overige stakeholders van de resultaten en de beste vervolgacties.Een bijzondere baan, omdat... jij de ethische kant van analytics een vast onderdeel van het werk van DF&A maakt. je afwegingen die je maakt ervoor zorgen dat je team de beste resultaten kan behalen. je met jouw kennis van ethiek het verschil maakt in de toepassing van analytics, ai en algoritmen binnen de Belastingdienst."Ik vind het heel interessant om zowel de technische, als de ethische en juridische aspecten van algoritmen te onderzoeken. Met de ontwikkeling en implementatie van verschillende methodes zorg ik dat algoritmen binnen de Belastingdienst op een ethisch verantwoorde manier ontwikkeld worden." Oliwia, data scientist ethiekWanneer past deze baan bij je? Je hebt wo-werk- en -denkniveau. Het liefst in combinatie met een masterdiploma in de richting van data science, AI of vergelijkbaar. Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met ethiek, data en analytics. Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als data scientist en hebt ervaring met de methodes en technieken en met programmeren in SQL, SAS en Python. Je hebt kennis van FairML-literatuur en het liefst ook ervaring met methodieken en toolkits, zoals AI Fairness 360, Fairlearn of Aequitas. Je hebt ervaring met het vertalen en begrijpelijk maken van ingewikkelde methodieken en resultaten voor stakeholders. Je hebt kennis van agile werken en het liefst ook ervaring in de praktijk. Je hebt bij voorkeur ervaring met het zelfstandig opzetten en geven van cursussen.Jouw competentiesInitiatiefOvertuigingskrachtOrganisatiesensitiviteitSamenwerkenZelfontwikkelingCorporate Dienst Datafundamenten en AnalyticsBijzonderhedenWe ontvangen je brief en cv graag in een Word- of PDF-bestand. Neem in de bestandsnaam jouw voor- en achternaam op. Als je een beroep doet op een voorrangspositie, stuur dan ook een kopie van die kennisgeving mee.Onze selectieprocedure voor deze functie ziet er als volgt uit: Allereerst wordt beoordeeld of een voorrangskandidaat binnen de Rijksoverheid in aanmerking komt voor deze functie. Daarna wordt beoordeeld of jouw cv en motivatiebrief voldoen aan de gestelde functie-eisen. Daarna vinden de selectiegesprekken plaats. Bij geschiktheid vindt tot slot het arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek plaats.Onderaan deze vacature vind je meer uitleg over de stappen die je doorloopt in de sollicitatieprocedure.De voorkeur gaat uit naar kandidaten die het meest aansluiten bij het opgestelde profiel. Dit heeft betrekking op zowel de genoemde kennis en werkervaring als op het opleidingsniveau. Vermeld deze daarom duidelijk in je cv.De Belastingdienst zet zich in voor de banenafspraak: zoveel mogelijk banen realiseren voor mensen met een arbeidsbeperking. Val jij in deze doelgroep? Wij zullen je ondersteunen zodat je optimaal kunt functioneren, en daarmee jouw bijdrage aan Nederland kunt leveren. Of het nu gaat om aanpassingen op je werkplek, bepaalde voorzieningen in het vervoer of bijvoorbeeld vergoedingen van het UWV: samen met jou, je leidinggevende én een jobcoach gaan wij kijken naar jouw kwaliteiten en mogelijkheden om een passend werkpakket uit te voeren. Wil jij weten of je hierbij hoort en wat dit exact betekent voor jou? Lees hier meer.Een (online) voorselectietest en/of een assessment kan deel uit maken van de sollicitatieprocedure, evenals het maken van een casus, het opvragen van referenties en (online) screening, bijvoorbeeld via databanken, (zoekmachines) en sociale netwerken.Jouw sollicitatie wordt alleen in behandeling genomen als je met de sollicitatie-button reageert en je cv en motivatiebrief zijn bijgesloten. Na sluitingsdatum is het niet meer mogelijk om je sollicitatie in behandeling te nemen. Houd er rekening mee dat het solliciteren technische problemen met zich mee kan brengen. Wacht hiermee dus niet tot het laatste moment.Wanneer je solliciteert op een functie maak je eenmalig een account aan. Met je account kan je de status van je sollicitatie inzien.De organisatieBelastingdienstBij de Belastingdienst werken ongeveer 25.000 mensen verspreid over het hele land aan een financieel gezond Nederland. Dit doen we door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen en premies volksverzekeringen te heffen, te innen en te controleren en fraude op te sporen. De Belastingdienst maakt het burgers en bedrijven zo gemakkelijk mogelijk om verplichtingen na te kunnen komen en gebruik te kunnen maken van rechten. Dat gebeurt met passende dienstverlening, door massale processen juist en tijdig uit te voeren én door adequaat toezicht uit te oefenen. De Belastingdienst is sterk in ontwikkeling en heeft de ambitie om de beste Belastingdienst voor Nederland te zijn met focus op fiscale taken en vakmanschap. Lees meer over de Belastingdienst op: https://over-ons.belastingdienst.nlDe afdeling - Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en AnalyticsDe Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics (DF&A) werkt voor directies van de Belastingdienst die belast zijn met de fiscale behandeling van burgers en bedrijven én voor bedrijfsvoering. DF&A levert signaalmodellen en informatiedashboards die zijn gebaseerd op de analyse van ‘big data’ en die de organisatie inzicht geven in de mogelijkheden om werkzaamheden slimmer en beter uit te voeren. Zo kunnen op informatie-gestuurde wijze keuzes worden gemaakt in bijvoorbeeld handhavingsstrategieën, behandeladviezen en procesinrichtingen.De signaalmodellen en dashboards worden gebouwd door gebruik te maken van innovatieve IT-ontwikkelingen en het koppelen van zeer divers aangeleverde data. DF&A maakt hiervoor gebruik van een zelfontwikkelde methodiek om data op te bouwen tot datafundamenten, die de basis zijn voor de producten.

title: Data Scientist
description: I am currently working with an Agritech scale up, who are on the look out for an experienced data scientist to join their growing team in Amsterdam. They are innovating in the field of vertical farming and autonomous greenhouses, with the aim of solving global food insecurityResponsibilities:You will play a vital role in development and implementation of data science strategy and use data to improve organizational growth, continuous improvements and iterations.Be a part of the main link between the business, customers and technology solutions by providing valuable insights through modelling and transforming datasets to help us make decisions and build customer solutions.Lead the strategic design, delivery and maintenance of the data science work that give meaningful insights on our performance, support the company's priorities and accelerate innovation.Have end-to-end ownership of data science work and lead alignment on all solutions developed through collaboration.Help build a data-driven culture within through data science workRequirements:- Strong knowledge of Python- Professional working experience within data science (2+ years of experience)- Experience with machine learning models is essential- Experience with the agriculture sector is beneficial but not required- Willingness to work with or previous experience in sensor dataSalary Package:• Up to €95,000 per annum (D.O.E)• Travel allowance• Hybrid working and the ability to work remotely for 4 weeks of the year• Annual bonus. (usually 5-8%!)• Pension scheme and 25 days of holiday (possibility to buy extra days)Feel free to apply below, or contact me on the following:Phone: +31203997864Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

title: Data Science Associate
description: Who We AreAdaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support the SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in all industries, across markets, and throughout their entire value chains.Adaptfy is also a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis is an embodiment of visionary thinking in the digital world. SHV is a globally established family of companies centered around the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.SHV's history is evidence of their courage to care for people, for business performance, and for generations to come. Their success is a testament to their constant re-invention through innovation.Adaptfy plays a pivotal role in bringing the innovation and the digital vision to life for all the SHV Groups across the world. We connect the dots for SHV, shaping the data-driven future for the whole family of companies.What We OfferInteract with senior stakeholders on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management and analytics processes.Work with Data Engineers to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation and visualization.Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.What you will doPerforming data analysis in the field of Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM analytics, and/or Risk analyticsAnalyses conducted in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.Communicating analyses via compelling presentationsSolving problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysisPreparing and facilitating workshopsManaging stakeholders and communicating with executivesCoaching and mentoring team members.What You’ll Bring3-5 years of professional work experience in the analytics domainAn advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, computer programming, etc.)An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysisStrong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, and/or R.Working knowledge of Python data tools (e.g. Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib)Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics a plusProfound knowledge of the English languageGood to have experience in the Retail and/or Banking industry

title: Jr Machine Learning Ops Engineer
description: Op het hoofdkantoorBij Albert Heijn werken is niet zomaar een baan. Het is werk met betekenis. Je werkt in een informele cultuur samen met een bevlogen team dat graag voorop wil blijven lopen en verschil wil maken. Met jouw unieke talent maak je impact op het leven van al onze klanten. Je leert van experts in hun vakgebied en we helpen je jouw loopbaan vorm te geven. Je kunt bij ons flexibel werken, zowel vanuit huis als op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Een baan bij Albert Heijn is niet alleen een baan voor nu, maar ook voor laterWat betekent dit voor jou?You’re finished work for the day, you’ve pushed your code, and it’s been reviewed and merged, you need to pick up some groceries on the way home. You bike to your local Albert Heijn and you think to yourself with a smile that the forecasting model that you and your team just deployed is already running behind the scenes to make sure that your favorite products are fresh and available! As you walk through the refrigerated aisles you pick up a bargain - some salad leaves that have been dynamically marked down to 70% off to make sure they sell before they expire and are wasted – again by a data science model running behind the scenes. You walk past the bakery department and think about the optimization that is running to help the bakers bake the right number of croissants tomorrow morning. Stepping out onto the street you think to yourself that it’s not just your local store – these models are running in more than a thousand stores across the Netherlands and Belgium. Furthermore, it’s not just the stores, the models your team builds are running in the supply chain and for online orders – ensuring efficient packing and delivery!Does a job with such tangible impact at such scale motivate you? Do you want to use your skills to solve a wide set of practical and challenging problems?We're looking for talented curious young people to come and strengthen our Operations Analytics and Data Science team!As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer at AH Technology, you will:Work on different aspects of our in-house machine learning solutions including software engineering, data engineering and automationCollaborate with product owners, analysts, data scientists and engineers to deploy and continually improve machine learning modelsSupport the team in following software engineering and MLOps best practices, for example by reviewing code and automating deployment and model management tasksContinually improve your coding and machine learning skills with the guidance of senior members and through participation in trainingWho you are:You have an MSc in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related disciplineYou enjoy writing pythonic, clear, extendable, testable code, and can apply Software Engineering best practicesYou can build a data pipeline using SQL, Spark, Pandas, or other relevant tools for transformation of relational dataYou are familiar with the concepts of version control and continuous integration and deliveryYou know the fundamentals of Machine Learning and StatisticsKnowledge of the following topics would be a plus:ContainerizationCloud platformsREST APIsFor more information about AH Technology, you can also visit https://blog.ah.technology/At AH Technology, we aim to grow, and that is only possible if you grow with us.That is why you get access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career.As we work together to build on our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):An inspiring head office in ZaandamA competitive salary up to € 60K - gross a year. (excl. holiday allowance)A profit distribution on top of your salary25,5 vacation daysAn ADV budget choice in which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days (+19,5 days), discounts or pay-outsFlexible working hours and the possibility to work from homeAn excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%Courses from our Albert Heijn Data AcademyAttractive discounts on various insurance policiesA travel allowance or a Traject OV-chip card for traveling to and from ZaandamA MacBook M1/M2 Pro and iPhone 1410% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per yearData Talent TrackLearning and personal growth are core values of our department. Our Data Talent Track is a one and a half year program available to our young analysts and data scientists. It consists of soft and hard skills training that helps you develop your professional skills. Courses on communication, on personal leadership and on writing better code. You’ll also get a chance to help out in the store for a day or help build the ideas of the future in a Hackathon.Want to know more?Follow this link: https://nl.linkedin.com/posts/noortje-van-genugten_ahtechnology-dataanalytics-albertheijn-activity-7062341484271792128-9AK0ApplyDo you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Apply via the button on this page. We ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role?What is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop?Want to know more before you apply for our role at AH Technology? Peter Dirks, Talent Acquisition Partner Data Science & Analytics, is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via peter.dirks@ah.nl

title: Data Scientist
description: DATA SCIENTIS WI-FI AND SMART HOME POSITIONFreelancer: 40 hours per week for a period of at least 6 months.Permanent: 40 hours per week LOCATIONFreelancer: Connect with us from anywhere in the world, as long as you groove to the rhythm of Amsterdam's dynamic timezone.Permanent: Join us in the vibrant heart of Amsterdam, Netherlands, where innovation meets tradition. ABOUT GAMGEE Based in the lively city of Amsterdam, Netherlands, Gamgee is a trailblazing user experience firm at the intersection of technology and innovation. Our mission is to empower users through our digital platform, allowing them to effortlessly manage their wireless networks, smart devices, internet access, parental controls, and cybersecurity measures. But that's just the beginning! We also offer identity protection, robust work-from-home solutions, and smart home monitoring and automation services. With Gamgee by your side, taking control of the digital realm has never been more intuitive or accessible. COMPANY CULTURE AND VALUES At Gamgee, we're committed to putting our customers at the forefront of everything we do. Our promise is to deliver an exceptional personal experience in the world of smart homes. We're all about simplifying complex technologies into user-friendly solutions, designed to enhance everyday living while fostering a profound sense of safety and tranquility. We're not just a tech company; we're a partner in the journey to a smarter, safer, and more connected home. JOB SUMMARY Ready to embark on a transformative journey with us? Gamgee is searching for a talented Data Scientist to join our passionate team. As we lead the charge in reshaping the smart home landscape, you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing Wi-Fi sensing data to create groundbreaking algorithms. These algorithms will not only redefine home security but also empower fall detection, pet and child monitoring, home automation, and so much more. Your work will be pivotal in realizing our vision of a smarter, safer, and more connected world. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Channel your expertise in DNN, RNN, and CNN to create, refine, and evolve AI algorithms that will drive our innovative applications.Craft algorithms for motion detection, localisation, categorisation, and assigning motions to people, pets, objects, and more.Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including Wi-Fi specialists, to ensure your innovations seamlessly integrate into our product offerings.Be at the forefront of developing advanced solutions for home security and automation. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bring your 2 to 5 years of expertise to the table, preferably in a similar role.Master the art of AI/ML, and if you have an inkling of Wi-Fi enthusiasm, all the better.Your ability to communicate and your business acumen are as sharp as your algorithms. EXPERIENCE: 2 TO 5 YEARS, PREFERABLY COLLABORATION You're not just joining a team; you're joining a movement. We embrace Agile Scrum methodologies, fostering innovation collaboratively. While you’ll have the independence to excel in your tasks, you’ll also be an integral part of a team that includes Wi-Fi specialists – experts you can rely on for their domain knowledge. TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES Python is your primary instrument, as your algorithms will be embedded in router software. Proficiency in other relevant programming languages is a plus.Dive into structured and unstructured data, and utilize industry reference data to unlock the full potential of your algorithms. REPORTING You'll report directly to the visionary CEO of Gamgee. APPLICATION PROCES AND CONTACT INFORMATION Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Send your resume and a captivating cover letter to hr@gamgee.com. At Gamgee, we move fast, so expect two or three rounds of interviews within an exhilarating 2-week timeframe. For inquiries and applications, please contact hr@gamgee.com to start your vibrant career adventure with us. Your journey to shaping the future of smart homes begins here!

title: Python Engineering & Machine Learning Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clientsYour teamYou will work closely with Aaron who leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. The data science team consists of two more data scientists, Rihab and Anna.Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models. Anna is specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will work with our Lead data scientist and DevOps engineer to manage our deployment processYou will maintain the libraries and codebase of our production recommender service. You will help us strengthen the machine learning processes on multiple cloud platforms and assist in training models. You will assist the data science team in developing internal tools for both prototyping and experimentationRequirementsIs this you?You have studied in a field like computer science, data science, or other quantitative fieldsYou are very comfortable in Python and enjoy optimising codeYou have a demonstrated ability to create applications using python web frameworks such as Flask or DjangoYou are familiar with PostgreSQL or similarYou have a demonstrable knowledge of Docker and comfortable with GitYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeExperience with KubernetesFamiliar with deployment on GCP or AzureCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Machine Learning Scientist, Payments
description: About The RoleWe are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our Payments Data Science and Analytics team and make meaningful contributions to our mission to streamline and optimize Uber's global payment experiences. In this role, you will be able to use your strong quantitative skills in the fields of machine learning, statistics, economics, operations research to improve the Uber Payments experience.Example projects we work on include: optimizing transaction routing and automated retry strategies to improve payment authorization success rates and rider/eater conversion as well as developing a new anomaly detection framework to help identify abnormal authorization patterns at any level of granularity in Uber's payment system.We are looking for experienced candidates with a passion for solving new and difficult problems with data. In this role, you will be able to use your strong quantitative skills in the fields of machine learning, statistics, economics, operations research to improve the Uber Payments experience.What You'll Do Design, build, deploy machine learning, statistical, optimization models into Uber production systems for a wide range of applications. Collaborate with multi-functional teams across areas such as product, engineering, operations, and design to drive system development end-to-end from conceptualisation to productionization. Understanding product performance and to find opportunities within data. Present findings to senior management to influence business decisions. Qualifications 3+ years of proven experience as a Machine Learning Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, Research Scientist, Software Engineer or equivalent. Experience in production coding and deploying ML, statistical, optimization models in real-time systems. Ability to use Python or other programming languages to work efficiently at scale with large data sets in production systems. Proficiency in SQL. Thought leadership to drive multi-functional projects from conceptualisation to productionization. Ph.D., M.S., or Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or other quantitative fields.

title: Applied Scientist
description: The Impact You Will MakeAs an Applied Scientist within our ADAS/ADS unit, you will be at the forefront of translating recent scientific advancements and cutting-edge technologies into real-world applications and products. Your impact will encompass Collaborating closely with a multidisciplinary team of Engineers, Data Scientists, and Applied Scientists to transform scientific breakthroughs into Advanced AI software solutions. Utilizing your analytical skills to develop automated approaches that harness the full potential of data streams, optimizing the quality and efficiency of our mapping processes. Taking a leading role in designing and implementing advanced (AI-enabled) systems that leverage multisensory data and multimodality models, with a specialized focus on autonomous driving and real-time map generation. Applying deep learning methodologies and machine learning algorithms to develop pioneering systems that empower the capabilities of our real-time map creation. Adapting and fine-tuning deep learning and machine learning models for seamless deployment on low-power embedded devices, ensuring enhanced performance and operational efficiency. Driving transformative changes by taking ownership of your responsibilities, contributing to the elevation of team performance and successful project outcomes. Demonstrating adaptability through embracing iterative development methodologies and addressing evolving technical challenges head-on. Leading the initiation of new projects, positioning yourself as a key technical influencer within the unit and departments, and guiding strategic technology decisions. Balancing intricate technical decisions with their broader business and operational impacts, making well-informed trade-offs to effectively meet the company's overarching objectives. Crafting code and designing structures that promote collaborative teamwork and facilitate enhanced productivity and engagement among team members. Facilitating the resolution of contentious technical discussions by building consensus and showcasing your adeptness at leading through influence. What You Will NeedA PhD or MS degree in computer vision, machine learning, or a related field, complemented by multiple research publications in top AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR etc.) or journals, or equivalent industry experience solving intricate AD and Mapping challenges. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and/or C++, enabling the seamless development and implementation of your solutions. An in-depth understanding of sensor data processing and multimodal sensor fusion, especially in working with Cameras and LiDAR. Prior experience with GIS and RADAR is a plus. Extensive expertise in various computer vision approaches and deep learning methodologies including image / point cloud registration and structure from motion, 2D / 3D object detection and segmentation, self-supervised learning, active learning, uni-/multi-modal foundation models etc., allowing you to continually innovate and adapt in response to evolving ADAS technologies. Keep abreast of related literature and a documented history of successfully steering ML research projects from inception to completion, covering problem formulation, experimentation, iteration, and eventual publication or product integration. Effective communication skills, encompassing both written and verbal proficiency, to clearly articulate complex technical concepts and collaborate harmoniously within a diverse team. Familiarity with programming tools and deep learning frameworks, including Git, OpenCV, PyTorch/TensorFlow etc. Nice to have Proficiency in map-related technologies such as SLAM, HD mapping, and geospatial data processing. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning tools Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, NumPy, Databricks, Spark, MLFlow, Hyperoptetc. General software tools Docker, Azure/AWS, GIS softwares like QGIS etc. What We OfferA competitive compensation package, of course.Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.Meet your teamWe're Product Unit Automation. We develop and operate map production systems for high-quality map data. This data goes on to power ADAS speed control, localization for L2+ robotics driving and more, helping TomTom on its mission to create the smartest, most useful map on the planet. In our team, you'll build data-oriented systems that leverage the freshest data through various sources, utilize machine learning techniques and improve themselves with quantitative and qualitative feedback.At TomTom...You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.Work with a team of 3,800+ unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs .TomTom is an equal opportunity employerTomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistLocation: UtrechtHybrid modelDuration: 1+ year rolling contractPreventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is crucial in our society, and as a leading organisation in the banking industry, we play a vital role. We seek a talented individual like yourself who thrives on analysing data, identifying patterns, and uncovering illegal activities to join our team.As a Data Scientist, you will optimise our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) system and ensure its future-proof by incorporating advanced analytics methodologies like Machine Learning.Position Overview:Our TM system evaluates millions of transactions daily and needs to perform within specified computing time and resource constraints. It is an ongoing development, with new computationally intensive functionality being added. Your role will be to optimise the performance of model components. However, this task is more than just technical; you will also need to thoroughly understand the functionality of the model and its elements within the context of transaction monitoring.Requirements:Academic degree (MSc/PhD) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (required)Strong software development skills, including Git, bash scripting, release management, and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics, modelling, or artificial intelligence activities with large data sets (required)Highly skilled in Python, PySpark, and Spark (required), with experience in Azure Databricks (preferred)Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Ideal Candidate:Motivated by the opportunity to make a measurable impact, such as catching criminals, rather than solely focusing on building complex analytics modelsStructured, precise, and communicative, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse individuals and rolesThrives in a high-impact, dynamic, and fast-paced environmentProactive, results-oriented, and has a business-focused mindset to fight financial crime effectivelyResponsibilities:The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering the following results:Enhancing functionality within our data model (TDM) while efficiently integrating all required data sources (30+) for Transaction Monitoring. These sources include transaction data, logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS, as well as enrichment data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM.Ensuring the TDM design enables Rabobank to comply with regulatory, audit, and internal requirements, including building versions on both account and customer levels.Establishing the TDM as a solid building block that can function independently and be leveraged by other KYC/TM projects.Optimising the computational performance of the TDM for daily batch scoring and one-off runs on multiple years of data using (Py)Spark.Assignment Description:The assignment aims to add functionality to our data model (TDM) to meet regulatory deadlines related to Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks, and tuning & back testing.The added functionality should be computationally optimised. Once set up and running, it will become a business-as-usual task that requires no external support.Regular alignment with technical and non-technical stakeholders, such as product owners, to ensure progress and results are on track.The Model Developer will review and accept proposed solutions that align with technical and functional requirements.

title: Data Scientist
description: Alfa Laval OceanGlide is an unique air lubrication solution with fluidic technology. It creates an even and controllable air layer across the entire flat bottom of the vessel, which is the best setup for reducing friction between the hull and the water. The proven reduction in drag means greater energy efficiency, lower fuel costs and less CO² emitted into the atmosphere. Along with reduced marine noise, these factors make OceanGlide an important step towards more sustainable shipping.About The JobCurrently we are searching for a results-oriented data scientist with a deep understanding in the field of machine learning, algorithm design, and object-oriented software design patterns. You will be actively involved in the development of data driven services.Working with a global team of data scientist and software engineers to deliver data driven solutions.Working closely together with the operations and technology department to better understand data gathered from our systems.Responsible for designing and deploying algorithms to automate the detection of anomalies.Presenting data in an understandable way so it can be discussed with engineers working in different disciplines.Responsible to maintain a software development pipeline and keeping the quality of software required for algorithms in check. Who You AreYou are comfortable with working with large data sets and are a proven team player who likes to work with different stakeholders. With your progressive way of thinking you find creative ways to get to solutions.Further, You HaveUniversity degree in Computer Science / Data Science / Artificial Intelligence (MSc, MEng, BSc, BEng).Experienced in applying different machine learning methodologies.Experienced with C++, C, or other general purpose programming languages.Experience with scripting in Python or other scripting languages.Feels responsible for the work delivered by the team and increasing its quality.Good understanding of software development practices.Good communicative skills.Fluent in English (spoken and written).What We OfferAs Data Scientist, you will become part of a diverse team of technical colleagues.The Job Benefits Include24 vacation days as well as 13 ADV days for a fulltime position.A performance bonus of up to 10% of your annual salary.A company fitness plan where you can get a discount in over 3000 sporting venues in the Netherlands.Flexible working hours, as well as the possibility to work from home.Do you want to be a part of Alfa Laval Rotterdam B.V.?Please contact me for more information or other career opportunities.Cemre ArslanCemre.Arslan@alfalaval.com+31 (0)648945452

title: Data Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDIGITAL Are you inspired to be part of the team that digitally reimagines the way we work at Mars?Do you want to practice your digital muscle and ability to engage others on the journey?Do you want to be part of the Planning Centre of Excellence, the driving force of a human centric digital planning transformation. And do you want to contribute to inspire moments of everyday happiness?Read more below….CONTEXT &THE TEAMIn this rapidly changing world, an agile supply chain (SC) makes the difference for our customer and consumers. Mars is transforming their supply chain to become more end to end connected, transparent, faster, agile, customer focused and digital. Mars believes that a human centric and digitally connected planning team is key to unlock this as it is the glue for one end to end SC team.The End to End Planning Center of Excellence (CoE) sits at the heart of this transformation. It can be seen as a digital catalyst to speed up and strengthen the planning transformation. We will share the common passion to bring the benefits of a digital way of working to the people in the (planning) operation all around Europe for their own benefit and that of customers / consumers. The team focusses on production sites in Europe and sales in 90 countries all over the world. It will operate by the principals of; full transparency of processes and data, planning by exception and continuous improvement of people processes and systems.Within the CoE the Insights & Analytics team (IA) is building the data driven decision making muscle to empower our EU MW planning & logistics colleagues. The IA team exists of business analysts who translate business needs and clarify real problem statement, and data scientists who are working on digital prototyping and solutions. On expertise and best practices, the regional team is linked to a Mars global analytics and data scientist network.THE ROLEThe data scientist have to make sure that data needs to be gathered in a way that can be easily re-used in the future (data infrastructure), the statistical analytics and forecasting tools need to be optimised and the reporting dashboards provide a real time intuitive summary. The DS engages with the business users to understand the real problem, engages with users to secure data quality and to provide a trusted solution required to create a user-friendly and intuitive dashboard. To face these activities the data analyst is working together with multiple teams that will help with the process knowledge and the stakeholder engagement the data analyst collaborates on these topics and gives guidance through his/her data insights and then leads the technical solutioning where needed. In this way the ideal data scientist has a strong technical profile with high business acumen and a passion to help people utilise digital tools.In practice this means the role has 5 key elements that are based on continuous improvement: 1. Agree and emerge themselves in the priority business problems to be solved. 2. Build the required and reusable data infrastructure for the best analysis 3. Solve data issues through technology or organisational alignment 4. Co-develop a repetitive mechanism to analyse and solve the problem. 5. Repeat the cycle.Key to this is to ensure that the digital solution is communicated and explained to the planning team in a non-technical way to ensure the result is accepted and not overwritten. This requires the ability to listen to market feedback, evaluate statistical findings / improvements, provide business insights on different level an aggregation and clearly communicate to stakeholders in their language.As this is a complete new way of planning in Mars this approach will to evolve over time. The data scientist will need to amend his leadership and stakeholder management style to this. Especially in the beginning it will be crucial to be able to bridge the gap between statistics and standard business way of working.Key ResponsibilitiesDefine focused value added planning problem-statements for balancing service, stock and cost for the business based on use-cases, design thinking and value stream analysis.Providing insights from data to support the organization making more and more data driven decisions in the area of: forecasting, supply planning, risk analyst in supply & demand, inventory settingPresenting results in a compelling and clear manner to drive business decision makingSupports demand sensing activities in E2Open through the provision of analysis and insights to optimize forecasting resultsBuild algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, interrogate, and extract good quality data needed for this.Look for opportunities to improve the flow of data and evaluate new and emerging technologiesIdentifying new relevant data sources and incorporating these in the data structure.Enhancing data collection procedures to create new data sourcesExperience / BackgroundEducation and ProfessionalB.S. or BA in computer science, data science, machine learning, mathematics, statistics or related natural science or technical degree. Master or advanced degree preferred3-5 years of experience working in a technical / analytics roleKnowledge / ExperienceExperience in a programming language such as PhytonExperience with data structures (SQL, Azure)Experience with ERP and Advanced Planning Systems (preferably E2Open or Rapid Response)Working knowledge of data mining, machine learning and other statistical techniquesUnderstanding of Lean / Six Sigma / root cause analysis, e.g., 5 why’sAbility to support complex analysis in understandable forms to business stakeholdersAttention to detail and a passion for data accuracyFluent in EnglishExperience in the aera of Supply Chain ManagementStrong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programmingStrong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programmingMars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Scientist Global Finance
description: At a glanceABN AMRO Clearing N.V. (AACB) is looking for a data scientist to join the Global Finance Data Science team. Do you want to be working in an ambitious data science team covering the financial markets and the clearing industry in an international environment? Thanks to our global network with offices in eleven countries and proximity to all major exchanges, you will serve the best trading firms on four continents.Your jobAs a data scientist you will work on multiple projects and do this with other Data Scientists in the team, where you will often take a leading role. Although we are part of the Global Finance department, our projects extend beyond the finance domain. For example, you will collaborate with colleagues from departments such as risk, operations, and commerce. In your work you will take care of the full development cycle. This includes the following topics:Identifying and exploring new opportunities, including experimentation with prototypes. Building explanatory (time series) models for data-driven business understanding and decision making. Examples are driver analyses for cleared volumes or pricing analysis. Building predictive / forecasting models. Examples are liquidity and trade volume forecasting.Building data pipelines of which the output can be used for our team (e.g. for feature engineering, or directly as input for models) or for colleagues to build dashboards on.Ad-hoc statistical analysis for senior management.Stakeholder management to make your projects a success, where stakeholders could be based in one of our offices in APAC, Europe, the US, or Brazil. Presenting your end-to-end data science solutions to a broad non-technical audience.Translating business use cases where we can apply innovative models such as GPT/large language models. The aim is to put models to production and for this we have supporting infrastructure to do so. With 6.2 billion transactions being cleared annually and with peak volumes of up to 51 million transactions per day, ABN AMRO Clearing produces a lot of data. In other words, lots of possibilities to do relevant and meaningful work for a data science professional.Working environmentABN AMRO Clearing is the cornerstone of global financial markets. We are a globally active multi-asset prime broker, custodian and general clearing member (GCM). We provide execution services, clearing, settlement, custody, securities lending, reporting and financing services for listed derivatives, cash securities, over-the-counter (OTC) products, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), commodities and foreign exchange transactions. We provide services from our offices across Europe, Asia-Pacific, Brazil and the United States. Our coverage includes all major exchanges and execution venues. AACB enjoys market share of 20% or higher for many of the major exchanges on which it operates. As a result, AACB consistently ranks among the top three clearers in every time zone, based on turnover and market share.Positioning in the organizationYou will be working in the Global Finance Data Science team in Amsterdam, reporting to the Global CFO, and closely co-operate with regional finance teams and other departments. We are a team of data enthusiasts, each with our own preferences and skills in the data science domain. With our diverse skillset, we strive for an open and supportive work environment that encourages professional growth and work pleasure. You will play a crucial role in our team as a technical lead in projects and as a mentor for our junior team members, offering you the opportunity to contribute your unique perspective and make your mark.Your profileWe are looking for the following criteria, we do understand that your skills might differ depending on your working experience:4+ years of working experienceMSc or PhD in STEM or related fieldExperience in applying ML and bringing ML models to productionExperience in Python for (statistical) analysis, ETL, feature engineering, and other data science tasksExperience in SQL to access databasesAbility to translate business opportunities to an end-to-end data science use caseAbility to communicate your results and solution to a broad audience, such as C-level management, IT colleagues, and finance professionals.Strong interest and motivation to work in the financial marketsExperience with Dataiku, Tableau, and AWS is a plusNL basedKnowledge about financial products and the financial markets is needed to do the job. Donâ€™t worry if your knowledge level is limited on these topics, we will provide training covering all essential information.We are offeringYou will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial industry and products and also further develop your data science skills. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits:A salary in hay level 10 or 11, depending on level of experience (ranging from €4.800 - €7.850 per month, based on 40 hours)An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employmentA personal development budget of â‚¬ 1,000 per yearAn annual public transport ticket for unlimited travelA good pension schemeA position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional developmentThe ability to work flexiblyInteresting work and challenging projects in an international environmentEqual opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Een motiverende kracht Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Job DescriptionIs this you?You love solving real-world problems with math & algorithms and are very capable of getting things done. You are highly motivated to create valuable solutions for our customers using the latest AI- and machine learning technologies.Your roleAs a Senior Data Scientist at Future Facts Conclusion you are responsible for (parts of) projects that include the development and productionization of our AI solutions. These vary from original development to the operationalization of large scalable models and the retrainable CI/CD of those models.You will need to set up several machine learning experiments, creating a model to see what happens to the data, and to make sure it continuously improves itself. It is important to keep an eye on the preconditions in order to deploy and monitor the model and focus on explainable AI.An important part of your role as Senior Data Scientist is making sure that a model contributes to business objectives and finding the balance between perfection and ROI. Being able to develop a visually attractive dashboard for a business, based on livestreaming or sensor data, KPI’s and insights into business value, is an important skill to have in this role.Since most of our clients work in Agile or DevOps teams and in AWS or Azure cloud environments, we have adapted them into our standards. Other tools we work with are for instance Pytorch, Scikit-learn, CDK, terraform and computer vision.Personal growth at Future Facts ConclusionWithin a skilled and ambitious team of various data professionals, you will work on various projects in which your personal development is key. Whether you prefer to deepen or broaden your knowledge on the technical side, or are considering the option to coach and help develop your colleagues’ skills, anything is possible. We will find you a role within a project team in which you can achieve your personal goals.A few examplesFor the largest chocolate manufacturer in the world, Barry Callebaut, our team has developed a model to predict the probability of child labor among local cocoa farmers.The project ‘Hollandse Luchten’, which translates roughly to ‘Dutch Skies’, uses experimental technology and investigates the value of new sensor technology for residents of North-Holland. An IoT platform in AWS has been set up in which air quality is continuously measured, together with measurement data from the citizens of North-Holland.RequirementsWhat you getA gross salary between €4.300,- and - €6.300,- based on 40hBonus package, a phone and laptop are of course includedMobility budget, a private internet plan and a general expenses allowanceA learning and development budget and a personal development schemeA young and ambitious team of data fanatics to share knowledge withA flexible workspace where you can organize your work-life balance just the way you like itOur very own Danz Café with a roof terrace and lots of team events where you can socialize with your colleaguesWeekly chair massage, a gym with personal training and a company longboat to go out onto the Amsterdam canalsWhat You NeedA university bachelor or master’s degree in a quantitative direction, such as Data Science, Computer Science, Econometrics, Physics, Mathematics, or Artificial Intelligence+3 years of relevant experience in applying Data Science and AI solutions (AI, ML, DL)Passion for creating value through data science, AI and machine learningThe ability to inspire and inform customers through clear explanation and data storytellingAn excellent command of both the Dutch and the English languageYour technical expertiseExperience with all aspects of the data science process (from problem definition and data collection to industrialization)Understanding of the ins and outs of pattern recognition, machine learning, statistical analysis and deep learningExperience with Python (knowledge of object oriented programming, algorithms and data structures)Experience with various Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, SciKitLearn, XGboost, Seaborn, Keras, PytorchAt least some experience with code standards, GIT and DevOpsYour Future Facts Conclusion?With a skilled and ambitious team of 40+ data professionals you will work on projects for new and existing clients all over the Netherlands where you will implement valuable AI solutions. We actively pursue projects in many different sectors. A few examples of our clients are PostNL, IKEA, ANWB, VodafoneZiggo and NS.Our data engineers and data scientists focus on productionizing valuable machine learning & AI solutions, and developing and deploying Machine Learning models. Every project is different, and therefore needs a different approach. With your team, you will determine the most efficient approach, and the appropriate tooling for each project. Your expertise and seniority makes you the perfect advisor on how to implement the solutions.

title: Data Scientist Sustainable Work and Smart Organisations
description: About This PositionSustainable employability of people is of great importance. Not only for the Netherlands, but also for Europe. The expertise group Sustainable Productivity and Employability consists of psychologists, movement scientists, health scientists, sociologists, data scientists and methodologists (more than 45 employees). They are committed to improving the sustainable employability of workers. We do this by working on solutions that enable the entire group of workers to remain healthy, vital and engaged at work for as long as possible. To achieve this, we conduct research, develop and evaluate interventions and solutions in the field of Foresight, skills matching, development (“lifelong learning”), adapting work (job crafting) and mobility (with aspects around flexibility).What will be your role?As a Data Scientist, you will work in the Smart Organisations team. This team consists of 7 colleagues. There is a lot of knowledge about labour market research, statistics and modelling. What we are missing now is knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and neural networks. This is where you come in. You will carry out various (inter)national research and consultancy projects in a team. The aim is to promote and safeguard the sustainable employability and productivity of employees. Your focus will be on conducting quantitative research, such asPerforming complex data analyses for health and labour data using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms and data visualisation tools to identify trends, patterns and insights analysing texts with text mining and Natural Language Processing; developing data infrastructure; linking data files (big data); tooling and implementation; securing knowledge about machine learning, deep learning and neural networks in the team; publishing research results, also in scientific journals. You will work together with subject matter experts and a TNO-wide network of Data Scientists who work on advanced analytical methods and artificial intelligence (AI). For example, the development of conceptual and theoretical explanations regarding occupational mobility and the meaning of skills. From your role, you will ensure the connection between the social scientists of the department and the AI specialists of other departments. In this way, you contribute to development and innovation within the SPE department and the Healthy Living and Work unit. In addition, you will participate in project proposals, quotations, (policy and advice) reports and articles in English and preferably also in Dutch.What We Expect From YouYou have demonstrable experience with machine learning, deep learning and neural networks. Think of working with analysis and programming software (R, Python, Matlab), up-to-date knowledge about artificial intelligence and text mining.You have a relevant (scientific) education. Think for example of data science, sociology, psychology, econometrics or another discipline within the social sciences).You have experience as a researcher and you also like to publish. You can have gained the experience in, for example, a PhD.You have an affinity with social issues and labour market research. Making social impact is what you do it for.What You'll Get In ReturnChallenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 4,500,- and € 5,750,- (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field. The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs. 33 days annual leave on a full-time basis. An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics. We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel. Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly. Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home. A good pension scheme. Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.TNO as an employerAt TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .The selection processPlease apply before the 7th of December, 2023. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.A certificate of Good Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.

title: Machine Learning Developer
description: Will you join our team?Are you looking for a new challenge? In our unit Group Provisioning there is a vacancy for a Machine Learning Developer (Fulltime).About Group ProvisioningThe unit Group Provisioning (GP) is a multidisciplinary unit with a range of responsibilities.
