title: Data Engineer
description: We’ve been pioneering a world of possibilities to bring surfaces to life for well over 200 years. As experts in making coatings, there’s a good chance you’re only ever a few meters away from one of our products. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and have set our sights on becoming the global industry leader. It’s what you’d expect from the most sustainable paints company, which has been inventing the future for more than two centuries.Purpose of the jobIntegrated Business PlanningThe Data Science team is positioned within the CoE IBP (Center of Excellence for Integrated Business Planning). IBP is the management process through which we run the company. It is a process of structured collaboration which aligns all layers and functions around one set of data, one plan, and joint decisions. In the CoE IBP, we standardize and optimize the planning cycle and E2E supply chain, as an end goal to optimize service level, cost, and inventory. This enables the company to achieve the best possible performance for our customers, employees, and shareholders.The Data Science team serves as the brain of the CoE IBP where insights are generated, processes are automated, and solutions are built. We are looking for (senior) data engineers to join our high performing team. We aim to attract and further develop the best Data Science & Supply Chain talent. You can find an impression of our team and some of the topics we work on in this testimonial of prior interns: Click here!Key Responsibilities:Collect business requirements from the various stakeholders (Data Scientists, Data Visualizers, Product Managers, IM) Translate business requirements into technical requirements, systems, and solutionsDesign, develop and document the technical solution: creation of data pipelines for data transfer between different storage servicesMaintenance of the solution: Actively monitor and manage the system/ solutions performance in close contact with the solution architectDevOps/ Agile WoWWhat do you bring? Basic QualificationsBSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or any quantitative fieldExperience in designing and building advanced ETL pipelines in a big data environmentBig data frameworks: Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, RapidMiner, Cloudera Programming languages: Scala, Python, PySpark, SQLSound communication skillsTeam playerCurious mindPreferred QualificationsMSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or any quantitative fieldPlatform: Azure Data Factory, Databricks, AlteryxExperience in supply chainFamiliar with AgileBecome Part Of An Outstanding CompanyAkzoNobel is consistently rated as one of the top employers in The Netherlands. You will join a company that is committed to achieving real sustainability. At a personal level you will also benefit from:a competitive salary with an above average number of annual holidays;participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan; travel expenses to and from work;opportunities for education that will help you to grow beyond this role;Fixed Bonus.Part-time: 32-40 hours workweekTraining: APICS, Microsoft Certification, Language Courses, Agile CoursesWe welcome your online application via https://www.akzonobel.com/en/careers. Only online applications including resume and a cover letter will be considered.The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds and further steps. An online assessment might be part of the selection process.An employment screening may be part of the selection process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.Requisition ID: 30975

title: Manager Data Engineering - Team management/growth and Data Architecture / Vision - Latest tech/tooling incl. Streaming on Databricks/Serverless Cloud - Amsterdam, Netherlands
description: If you’re into the latest Data related technology/tooling, architecture and Team Leadership this Chapter lead / Data Engineering Manager role is the best.This is your role…- You’ll lead and grow the internal Data Engineering team to ~8 direct reports in the next year or 2 whilst you’re able to zoom out to further establish the best Data Architecture Vision for the team/company.- Your team is using the latest tech/tooling like Databricks Workflows, Apache spark structured streaming, Delta Live Tables, Change Data Capture, PySpark, Unity Catalog which all runs on AWS Serverless with IaC (Terraform/Cloudformation) with mainly Python for coding and ELK, Grafana and Prometheus for monitoring/logging. You don’t need expert knowledge in all of them! 😉- The company has many different data sources and feeds data to AI models and machine learning in production. Big volumes of on-demand requests by clients are handled by Stream processing;- 95/100% is greenfield work. They don’t do much ‘lift and shift’ or migrations and most of the work for your team is completely new and absolutely cutting edge;- Domain based teams… You advocate the Data domain within the larger organization and work with domain driven design;- Solid budget to stay up to date with (leadership/tech) courses, experimenting, conferences etc.What do you bring?- You have at least 6+ years of relevant working experience in the data sector;- Expert experience in production grade data ingestion, processing, pipelines, and modelling;- Experience in managing or coaching people / teams;- Strong leadership, communication skills (English), and collaboration skills;- You have a drive to develop innovative solutions and focus on continuous improvement;- Preferably experience with cloud environments.The company:This is a pure tech company with a lean mindset. Tech/Data drives the company and the Engineers drive the decisions and take responsibility in tech. Data is the core business and the products / services drive an important part of the Dutch (financial) economy. The product is moving abroad which means more scale challenges. This company works with huge amounts of data that is delivered to users by near real-time Stream processing. Platform latency, reliability, availability and performance are top priorities.Located near a train station in the Centre of Amsterdam means you can access the office easy by car, public transport or bicycle. You're working in a dynamic, industrial environment with a total of 90 colleagues of which 60% is tech/product. The team is international and in-house language is English.Salary & Benefits:The salary is competitive and depends on what you bring to the table in terms of skills, personality and experience. The secondary benefits are good; 30% knowledge migrant ruling, VISA sponsorship, pension, hybrid work, flexible working hours, option to work part time (32h/36h a week), bonus, laptop, travel allowance, holidays, holiday allowance, personal development budget, etc.

title: Data Engineer
description: Dit ga je doenAls Data Engineer binnen het Data Insights & Analytics team ben je technische kracht achter de ontwikkeling en onderhoud van dataproducten. Door uitbreiding van het team en grote strategische aandacht voor data gedreven besluitvorming moet de ontwikkelsnelheid van dataproducten omhoog. Hierbij is het aan jou de taak om solide data pipeline processen (ETL) op te zetten. Factoren als tijdigheid, kwaliteit en monitoring van het proces komen hier om de hoek kijken. Je verzamelt, structureert en integreert data, die kunnen worden gebruikt door je directe collega’s voor verschillende dataproducten zoals analyses, dashboards, specifieke datamarts of Data Science ontwikkelingen.Wat doe je zoal als Data Engineer in de dagelijkse praktijk?Je werkt op een Agile manier samen binnen het Data Insights & Analytics team met andere data professionals zoals data scientists, analisten en visuele experts.Je ontwikkelt nieuwe dataflows in SQL, Azure, DataBricks of Alteryx of ontsluit complete nieuwe databronnen die binnenkomen via bv. SFTP-servers of APIs.Je zorgt ervoor dat de data en processen kwalitatief goed zijn en makkelijk te monitoren en onderhouden zijn.Je denkt kritisch mee om de beste oplossing voor de organisatie te kiezen die toekomstbestendig zijn.Daarnaast werk je samen met je collega’s van Group IT en functioneel beheer. Dit krijg je ervoor terugElke dag werk je samen, onderneem je binnen onze internationale organisatie én worden we samen een beetje beter. Daar krijg jij kansen én ontwikkelmogelijkheden voor terug. Maar er is meer…Een snelle omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren met groot werkplezier door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en de ruimte om jezelf te ontplooien. #bepartofmore Best belangrijk: een goed salaris! Afhankelijk van jouw ervaring start je tussen de € 4.300,- en € 5.800,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek. Plus personeelskorting bij Kruidvat, Trekpleister en ICI PARIS XL! 24 vakantiedagen en een aantrekkelijke ATV-regeling met 19,5 dagen op fulltime basis. Liever meer vrije tijd of extra geld? Koop of verkoop vakantiedagen of laat je ATV (deels) uitbetalen. Volop ontwikkelings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met onze eigen A.S. Watson Academy. Bij A.S. Watson sta je nooit stil.Goede thuiswerkmogelijkheden. Hybride werken (50/50) is bij ons heel gewoon en gaat altijd in goed overleg. Dit ben jijJe hebt een afgeronde opleiding op hbo- of wo-niveau, bij voorkeur richting Bedrijfskundige Informatica, Software Development of een andere studie met een specialisatie in Data Enginering. Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Engineer of DevOps.Je hebt een passie voor data en softwareontwikkeling en bent bedreven in SQL en Python.Kennis van Alteryx, Azure, PySpark, Databricks of BigQuery is mooi meegenomen evenals kennis van SAP Business Objects of Tableau.Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit, bent oplossingsgericht, gestructureerd en accuraat: je gaat door totdat je de oplossing hebt gevonden en gaat hierbij grondig en secuur te werk. Je beheerst naast het Nederlands ook de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift, dit is belangrijk omdat je ook samenwerkt met internationale collega’s en leveranciers.

title: Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks
description: At a glanceAre you a technical expert and enthusiastic person who inspires others to create innovative solutions? Then we need your help in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!One of our strategic goals is to become a data-driven organization so we can get to know our clients even better and serve them in a better way. As a chapter lead, you contribute to these goals by focusing on IT craftmanship within your department. You stay up-to-date on the latest developments and you mentor your team members in becoming technical experts. How are you going to shape craftmanship and innovation within your department?Our Engineers get the freedom to grow and experiment. You support and guide them so that they can grow their technical expertise that contribute to a future-proof bank. When and where you and your team do your work is up to you! We work hybrid, which means you can flexibly decide where and when you can work most comfortable and effectively.As Chapter Lead, you will work at the department Risk Data & Modelling. You and your chapter members are responsible for multiple data platforms like the Risk Analytics Platform and the CoDaC Platform, two Azure platforms used for credit risk data modelling purposes and non-financial risk analysis and reporting. Besides that we are setting up a platform for Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) use cases.Your jobYou will combine working as an IT Engineer with your role as Chapter Lead. About 60% of the time, you will work in your own Scrum Team but also closely with Data Engineers and Data Analysts in other teams on designing and developing future-proof IT solutions of the highest quality.The rest of the time you will manage your chapter. This includes:Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations.Mentoring your Chapter members on technical craftsmanship.Actively participating in knowledge gaining and sharing by joining triangles, circles, communities and events.Proper alignment with stakeholders. For example, informing leadership on the alignment you have with the Solution Engineer on the technological landscape and lifecycle. Working in an Agile environment and advocating the Agile and CICD processes.You mentor your Chapter, evaluate technical assessments, do interviews and ensure that new employees are properly onboarded.Take care of the HR processes to facilitate all aspects relating to the influx, development, performance and outflux of employees.Create and foster a healthy working environment and an inclusive culture for your Chapter.Working environmentThe Risk Data & Modelling department is a young department within Risk. We are an ambitious and very international group of people. We have embraced an Agile way of working where we strive towards a flat organization with self-organizing teams that have the autonomy to make quick decisions. The atmosphere in the team and the department is open and informal. You will work in a diverse team with many different nationalities, and a good ratio of Juniors, Mediors and Seniors. We work hard, but we also know how to have fun!You will work in a fast paced and accessible environment. We love to share knowledge and to challenge each other, for example by sharing our expertise in our blog, during the events of our developer community and by organizing hackathons.Your profileYou feel at home in a technical environment and are always up to date on the latest technologies. At the same time, you are people-minded and an inspirator. You get enthusiastic from creative and innovative solutions, and you inspire others to get started with these new opportunities.Do you think you‘re a fit? Check your profile:Expert in data engineeringExperienced with cloud solutions and infrastructure (preferably Azure)Hands on with building data solutions with Data and Orchestration tooling (i.e. Data Factory, Databricks/PySpark and Airflow) and PythonDeep understanding of data processes, data pipelines (ETL), and data lifecycleExperience with coaching and mentoring your less experienced team members in their design and development activities You have knowledge of and are interested in the latest IT-trends, both within and outside your area of expertise (cloud, API, Open Banking, DevOps, CI/CD, SOA, etc.)Fluent in EnglishWe are offeringYou are given every opportunity and independence to demonstrate your professional expertise in a no-nonsense environment and to further develop yourself. We attach great value to personal development and thereby offer you many training and development opportunities. In addition:A Hay 10-11 salary.The freedom to optimize your performance in a flexible working environment.Possibilities for flexible working hours and good facilities for remote working.A supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible benefits (including vacation days, mobile phone, (electric) bicycle and additional salary).25 vacation days.Apart from the departmental training budget for the department you will receive a personal development budget of € 1.000 per year which can be save up to a maximum of € 3.000.An annual public transport pass.A generous pension scheme.Banking for better days. These are days you can use for your personal development or on which you can contribute to society.Interested?Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy!We would like to get to know you!Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.Wij vragen Natuurlijk leiderschap Passie voor je vakgebied

title: Senior Manager AI / Gen AI
description: The workAs a Senior Manager in Artificial Intelligence you will have a 70% focus on client advisory and project delivery and a 30% focus on pre-sales, using thought leadership to co-create, shape and sell new offerings to our clients.People You have experience leading and managing a team of data scientists, ML engineers, and other AI professionals. Ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, stakeholders, and partners.Process You gained deep knowledge of project management methodologies and frameworks and have the ability to oversee projects from inception to delivery while managing timelines, budgets, and resources.Technology You have a strong understanding of the field of Artificial intelligence, for example in the fields of machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing technologies. You know the benefits of each and can also explain differences between the many available platforms. With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.Who We AreThrough unmatched industry experience, leading technologies from our ecosystem partners and startups, and the largest delivery network in the world, we provide a powerful range of capabilities that can be tailored to our client’s most complex business needs. With over 100 innovation hubs deployed around the world, we help clients continuously innovate at speed and at scale so they can outpace their peers. You will bring innovation, intelligence, and industry experience together with the newest technologies to help clients innovate at scale and transform their businesses.Technology is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Strategy & Consulting, Operations, Song and Industry X.Here’s What You’ll NeedThought Leader You have a clear vision on Data & AI, what direction the capability will move towards and are able to share this vision to both your colleagues and our clients.Business Translator You are able to identify and build a vision on business problems, initiative, analytics intervention, data scientist management, data science interpretation and storytelling.Data & Analytics Transformation You have experience with setting up current state assessment, operating models, value case, roadmap, and blueprint in the Data & AI landscape.You are an expert in the following technologies: programming/scripting languages like Python, R, and SQLYou are familiar with big data tools like Spark, PySparkKnowledge of natural language processing (NLP) technologies like spaCy, NLTK, and CoreNLP. Experience with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.Experience with computer vision libraries like OpenCV and Dlib.Knowledge of Bayesian networks and decision trees.Familiair with hyperscaler offerings and 3rd party technologies: AzureML, Vertex.AI, AWS Sagemaker, DatabricksBonus points if you haveYou have worked for 5+ years in a consulting capacity or project management type roles. Experience in a sales capacity is a plus. Experience with GenerativeAI implementationsYou are fluent in Dutch and English (both spoken and written). You have experience with data acquisition, ingestion, and pre-processing for AI projects and know what it takes to design, implement and manage data pipelines for large-scale AI projects.What’s in it for you?Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises:Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trustEmbrace a sustainable growth mindsetLive a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people.Lead and transform our clients with technologyConnect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues.These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including:Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location, FlexMoment leave of absence program (50% paid leave of absence for 3 months) and FlexDay; a flexible day you can take off to celebrate what matters to you – from EidalFitr to a birthday.Paid leave: Parental leave, Partner leave for all non-birthing parents, Bereavement leave, and Gender affirmation leave.Paid transport (budget for electric bicycle or car, NS-Business card)Pension scheme, Accenture shares, annual bonus, collective health insurance schemeSocial activities like Friday Drinks, sport events and partiesWhat We BelieveAccenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities.Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with.Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodation to enable your participation in the recruitment process by emailing ezra.lammers@accenture.com. We will be happy to assist you.

title: Data Engineer
description: Als Data Engineer Consultant is je voornaamste taak om gegevens voor te bereiden voor analytisch of operationeel gebruik. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het bouwen van datapijplijnen om informatie uit verschillende bronsystemen samen te brengen. Je integreert, consolideert en zuivert gegevens en geeft die structuur voor het gebruikt kan worden in analytische toepassingen.Wat wij van jouw vragen:Kennis van en werkervaring op gebied van data engineering;Kennis van datamodelleren conceptueel en dimensioneel;Ervaring met cloud architecturen;Ervaring met Cloud (bijvoorbeeld Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc.);Ervaring met Scrum, Agile en Devops werkwijze;Ervaring met technologieën als Databricks, Spark Structured Streaming en PySpark;Ervaring met vertalen van de functionele en non-functionele wensen van de gebruiker naar passende oplossingen;Ervaring met analyseren van brondata en het ontwerpen van datamodellen.Wat wij jou bieden:Uitdagende opdrachten bij de top-500 Nederlandse organisatiesEen professionele werkomgeving met zeer ervaren collega’s;Keuze in opdrachten;Uitgebreide trainings- en certificerings mogelijkheden;Vast dienstverband;Een goed salaris, aangevuld met een aantrekkelijke bonus;Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals leaseauto, laptop en vaste vergoeding voor mobiele telefoonkostenWe willen dat jij je kunt richten op je passie. Sc.Tiger helpt je bij elke stap in je carrière. Ons team en collega-experts zijn er voor je en staan achter je. Laat Sc.Tiger je helpen in je journey.

title: Senior Consultant_ Data Engg
description: Job DescriptionResponsabilities Key technical skills and experience Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring data consistency and quality. Implement and maintain robust data pipelines to collect, process, and transport data from various streaming and batch sources to our data storage and analytical systems. Clean, preprocess, and transform data as needed, utilizing ETL and ELT processes and tools to prepare data for analysis. Develop data validation processes and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability. Continuously optimize data pipelines for efficiency, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. Work with data security team to implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations. Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, workflows, and systems. Work closely with data scientists, analysts, devOps and stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide support for data-related projects. Monitor data pipelines and proactively address issues to ensure data availability and reliability. Steer technical migration and upgrades including migration to cloud. Collaborate with project management team to implement data governance and embed it into processes. Coach and mentor team to drive towards effectiveness and collaboration Work with Engineering Manager and peer Tech Leads to plan, build and execute technical sustainability roadmap Strong knowledge of implementing and maintaining scalable streaming and batch data solutions with high throughput and strict SLA. Extensive experience of working in production with Kafka, Spark and Kafka Stream including best practices, observability, optimization, performance tuning. Knowledge of Python and Scala including best practices, architecture, dependency management Experience of working in production with Ansible, Graphite, Kafka Stream, Kubernetes, Airflow, Mesos, Marathon, Grafana, ELK, Graphite, Pyspark Hands on experience in Google Cloud Data Engineering tools focused on BigQuery , Dataproc , Dataform , Dataflow, Composer, Google Cloud Storage Experience with Linux OS Experience with Git and versioning control. Experience with ArgoCD Experience with handling complex range of multi-tenant data products in production Experience in leading geo distributed teams Experience in working with Agile , Scrum and Kanban methodologies.

title: Data Engineer
description: Over onsagap2 is een Europese IT Consultancy, actief in 14 landen met ruim 8.000 werknemers. Het bedrijf is in Portugal opgericht en sinds 2014 actief in Nederlands met ons kantoor in Amsterdam om de Nederlandse markt te voorzien van onze IT expertise. Onze werknemers worden gekenmerkt door de zogenaamde “agapian spirit”, die in 5 woorden wordt samengevat: familie, samenhorigheid, vriendschap, teamgeest en leren.Kun jij je vinden in hetgeen waar wij voor staan?Lees dan verder om meer te weten te komen!FunctieomschrijvingAls Data Engineer bij agap2 ga je de uitdaging aan binnen een internationale omgeving met een lokale focus. Jij krijgt de mogelijkheid om aan diverse projecten te werken, op basis van jouw ervaring en interesses. Denk hierbij aan projecten binnen diverse industrieën zoals Banking, Telecom en Healthcare.Bij agap2 wordt er verwacht dat je jouw kennis deelt, terwijl je ook de kans krijgt om nieuwe technologieën te leren en nieuwe vaardigheden te ontwikkelen. Wij geloven dat het delen van kennis de sleutel is tot persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Ons talent management programma is op maat gemaakt om jou de mogelijkheid te geven om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te groeien in je carrière, op de manier die jij altijd al voor ogen hebt gehad. Doordat we met een breed scala aan klanten samenwerken, wordt er ook van je verwacht dat jij je kunt aanpassen aan verschillende omgevingen.Wat breng jij meeEen afgeronde opleiding op HBO/WO niveauMinimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data EngineerErvaring in de Microsoft Azure Business Intelligence Stack (DataBricks, Synapse Analytics, DataFactory en LogicApps)Ervaring met het bouwen van ETL's/ELT's, bij voorkeur in PySpark en Airflow.Ervaring met Python en SQL is een must.Ervaring met werken in Agile omgevingen met behulp van Scrum (SAFe, Less, Nexus).Je spreekt en schrijft goed Nederlands en EngelsJe bent een teamspelerWat wij je biedenCompetitief salarisVolledige reiskostenvergoedingPensioenregeling25 vakantiedagenLaptop en mobiele telefoonOp maat gemaakt talent management programma om jouw professionele doelen te bereikenPrettige en informele werksfeer binnen een internationale organisatieUitdagende projecten op basis van jouw interesses en ervaringRuimte voor eigen inbreng en ideeënToegang tot tech events, teamuitjes en andere evenementenIs er nog ruimte voor plezier? Jazeker! De combinatie van plezier en ontwikkeling is belangrijk in ons team. Om een kleine impressie te geven: ons team bestaat uit meer dan 10 nationaliteiten en we organiseren regelmatig tech meetups, teamuitjes, vrijdagmiddagborrels en pub-quizzen.Bij agap2 verdedigen wij gelijkheid en waarderen wij diversiteit. Wij creëren een veilige en diverse omgeving waar kansen voor alle medewerkers gelijk zijn!Alle kandidaten met vaardigheden die aansluiten op deze vacature zijn welkom om te soliciteren. There is agap2 join us!

title: Data Visualization Specialist
description: We are Leads.io — the world’s #1 tech-driven lead generation agency. Leads.io is on the search for a Martech Specialist to complement our dynamic work environment. Your expertise in advertising technology, web tracking, and 1st party data will be instrumental in creating high-impact lead-generation strategies. With a determination to become an ever-better growth catalyst for our clients, we are on the lookout for fresh faces to join our team! Do you have what it takes to join Leads.io?About The RoleJoin the new and growing Business Intelligence team at Leads.io. Transform large sets of marketing and social media data into easy-to-use, communicative dashboards that help teams make data driven decisions. Find key insights and shape how teams understand these large datasets.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain data visualizations, dashboards, and BI reporting for business units across the organizationIdentify and communicate key trends to business units and stakeholdersCollaborate with teams to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs)Manage, organize, and update datasets for use in Tableau and other data visualizations and reportsSupport ongoing reporting and data request needs Requirements2+ years of experience as a data analyst or doing data visualizationProficient with creating Tableau dashboardsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsFamiliarity with SQL and/or Tableau Prep (or other ETL / data prep tool)Familiarity with marketing and social media analyticsExperience with Salesforce or other CRM systems a plusBenefitsWhat’s in it for you?25 holidays per year with 8% holiday payHybrid working/working from home allowanceAn open and inclusive culture that fosters personal growth and initiativeKnowledge sessions hosted by internal and external expertsDaily lunches at the officeFlexible working hoursProvided equipment (Macbook, mouse/keyboard)Access to mental health support through OpenUp is offered anonymously and without costThe opportunity to work fully remotely for up to a month per year from a location of your choiceExcited? Wait until you see our cultural values!✨ Trust – At Leads.io, we emphasize accountability and transparency, setting the foundation for genuine partnerships.✨ Own it – Ownership entails having pride in both your work and yourself. We each aim to take a personal initiative in improving our business, so being the best version of yourself is the best-case scenario for us.✨ Grow smart – Our vision is to become a global frontrunner in lead generation. We are committed to continually scaling our business whilst also growing as individuals in the process.✨ Thrive as a team – We believe that teamwork is a key ingredient to obtaining outstanding results. While holding personal work ethics in high regard, we also encourage a working environment that is both social and more enjoyable through teamwork.Our recruitment process is designed to ensure the best fit. It comprises a phone meeting to discuss qualifications, followed by two interviews for cultural alignment, between the 2 interviews an assessment for technical skills will follow. If successful, we will extend a formal offer. Upon acceptance, you'll embark on your exciting journey with Leads.io.Ready for your new challenge? Apply now, and we will be in touch with you soon!

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data Analyst
description: Sam Media is a team of passionate and fearless creatives, marketing experts, Data wizards, and developers focused on delivering great products and services to hundreds of millions of mobile consumers worldwide. We are one of the pioneers and a leader in the mobile micropayment sector.We are an online performance marketing company, we build and market our products including Mobile Apps, Streaming Video and Music Services, Online Learning Portals and Mobile Games. Millions of users engage with our promotional content and digital ads every single day.We are a diverse team of more than 34 nationalities based in Kuala Lumpur, Amsterdam, Dubai, and Hanoi. We value ambition, open communication and learning from each other.As a data analyst, you will have a central role contributing to many decisions that we make every day. You develop actionable, data-driven insight for optimization of our creative campaigns, discovering hidden opportunities, or digging into the root cause of a discrepancy. You make sound arguments, supported by data for taking or discarding an opportunity.We are looking for a motivational candidate who can support our multidisciplinary teams finding actionable insights from our data and also work on developing new tools that help our company improve business performance from our Amsterdam office.About YouYou have hands-on software development and analytical skills. Our ideal colleague should love getting their hands dirty with building solutions, doing research, analyzing data and programming. You will need knowledge in designing and shipping solutions and tools across the whole stack.What will you be doing?Supporting our cross-functional teams. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, generating reports, preparing data visualizations, and using data to forecast or guide business activity. Our main tools for this are Redshift (SQL) and Quicksight.Find actionable insights on our data and communicate them to improve and optimize our business.Design, build/improve and maintain internal projects built in Python, such as our early alerting system or our IP targeting optimization project. Both projects are currently being used within the company for error monitoring and process optimization respectively. And if you feel brave enough you can help to deploy them with Docker and Airflow!What do we expect from you?You should have a passion for coding, optimizing for business value and enjoy solving problems and building correct, extensible and simple solutions that match our scale and load.You should be proficient with Python and SQL. Having 3+ years of relevant experience as an analyst and/or software developer.Several of our projects are being built using Django, would be a plus if you have previously worked using this framework as we are continuous developing these projects.We use AWS suite (Redshift as our main analytical database along a swarm of EC2 to keep our services alive), Docker, Git, Airflow so a basic understanding of these technologies would be a nice to have.You are able to work in a fast-paced and multicultural environment where the main working language is English so fluency in verbal and written English is a must.What do we offer?A Competitive salary in line with market conditions and your skills and experienceAlthough this position isn't remote, we offer flexible working schedules.Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture. We trust our team members to get the job done, how they do it is up to them.We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company tripWe have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.We offer visa sponsorship and a comprehensive relocation package when applicable.

title: AI & Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description: About RoleAs a AI & Business Analyst Intern you will work daily on data analytics / strategy consulting tasks and projects related to mining and researching data, later on data optimization, cleaning, and finally on the interpretation and data visualization for clients and internal company needs. You will use many AI tools, test them and definitely master daily the use of generative AI tools.Your mission:AI first approach - we use AI in all possible cases that is availableConduct insightful, ad hoc analyses and informative, actionable global markets research and reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvementCollaborate with other teams to build valuable content using BI and market insights solutionsDevelop dashboards and descriptive analytics solutions for clientsPrepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trendsTake care of data integration and data / database managementSupport and maintain existing BI solutions and resolve bugs as they ariseYour perks:Access to very extensive educational resources and opportunitiesFlexibility (work from home / remote setup)Hi-tech and world-class working tools available also for personal useLife-coaching & mentoring arranged by senior internal and external mentorsTeam-buildings that are really different from “standard” companiesYour superpowers:Currently enrolled in a University degree (Bachelor/Master) or fresh graduateGenerative AI and other AI tools daily user Serious interest in market research, consulting, HR and finance auditYour personality captivates with enthusiasm for innovation, curiosity and the courage to question facts and always double-check dataAbility to thrive in fast-paced environment with competing priorities and last-minute changesStaying on top of all innovation-related news and leveraging your experience to conceptualize innovation strategies and methodologiesBusiness acumen and client’s focusBasics and willing to improve skills in: Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, Qlick, etc.Your mission frame:Type: Full Time/Part Time internship (40/30h per week)Compensation: Non-paid / Students' scholarshipsLocation: Remote Duration: 3+ Months, optional to be extended up to 12 monthsStart: ASAPThe exact starting date of the internship can be flexible after successful interviews and agreement.Note: Due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only respond to applications that match our criteria and expectations. Thank you for understanding.Powered by JazzHRjpuhIE6Ozz

title: Data Analyst
description: 🔋🔋 Data Analyst 🔋🔋1-2 day in the office a week (its up to you!)€95k per annumUtrechtSustainabilityStarting salary up to €7,800/month, electric car lease, €150 per month professional cost cover , €850 phone budget (renewed every 3 years), €3,000 laptop budget (renewed every 3 years), pension, min 5% bonus, huge growth potential, a pioneering opportunity within the sustainability sector, work on innovating greenfield projects amongst other standard benefits.Who are they…This is a company for extraordinary talent. A company that does amazing things that makes the Digital future for their clients happen. With a unique approach and attitude! Using data, AI and IoT.They build data heavy intelligent solutions which captures real time data to...Reduce the energy impact of entire cities!!Help in the fight against cancerThey design and build innovative solutions that have the power to transform businesses so that they stay competitive and can continue to grow. Digital Strategy execution that makes companies more agile and flexible. Advanced Analytics that gives them insight into what happens now or in the nearby future by recognising specific patterns in their data."It’s easy to build something complex. It’s pretty hard to create the same thing elegantly simple. That is why you need the smartest people you can get."We are actively seeking a number of Medior & Senior Data Analysts who have a passion to develop innovative, sustainable platforms.Key Requirements…Ability to develop and implement Azure Synapse, Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL Server and PowerBIExtensive experience in SQL and no-SQL query languageExperience building ETL pipelinesThe "You're too perfect" Wish List…Understanding of core data integration technologies such as Power Automate and Logic Apps.Experience with AI and/or IoT How to Apply…Directly apply to this post with your CV or…Call Will Aldred on +31 202414822 (Direct Line)

title: Power BI Developer
description: Job Overview:As a Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data visualizations and reports using Power BI. Your primary focus will be on creating data-driven solutions that empower decision-makers and enhance business performance, with a particular emphasis on the semiconductor industry. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, with a strong understanding of Power BI and excellent communication skills.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.Optimize and streamline data sources for efficient data retrieval and analysis.Implement data security and access control to protect sensitive information.Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decision-making.Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues related to Power BI reports and dashboards.Keep up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in Power BI and data visualization.Communicate effectively with clients and internal stakeholders, presenting data insights and recommendations.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).8+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, and data visualization.Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M Query.Experience working with semiconductor clients is a significant plus.Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, for effective client interactions and team collaboration.Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team, with strong problem-solving skills.Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.Project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.Powered by JazzHRcd1mowl9WY
